<title>SONY GROUP CORPORATION 6-K</title>

 
<h5 align="left"><a href="https://www.sec.gov/Archives/edgar/data/313838/000119312522030320/d270438d6k.htm#toc">Table of Contents</a></h5>


<center><div style="width:8.5in" align="left">
 <p style="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10.5pt; font-family:Times New Roman" align="center">SECURITIES AND EXCHANGE COMMISSION </p>
<p style="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10.5pt; font-family:Times New Roman" align="center">WASHINGTON, D. C. 20549 </p> <p style="margin-top:10pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10.5pt; font-family:Times New Roman" align="center">FORM <font style="white-space:nowrap">6-K</font> </p> <p style="margin-top:10pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10.5pt; font-family:Times New Roman" align="center">REPORT OF FOREIGN PRIVATE ISSUER </p>
<p style="margin-top:10pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10.5pt; font-family:Times New Roman" align="center">Pursuant to Rule <font style="white-space:nowrap">13a-16</font> or <font style="white-space:nowrap">15d-16</font> of </p>
<p style="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10.5pt; font-family:Times New Roman" align="center">the Securities Exchange Act of 1934 </p>
<p style="margin-top:10pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10.5pt; font-family:Times New Roman" align="center">For the month of February 2022 </p>
<p style="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10.5pt; font-family:Times New Roman" align="center">Commission File Number: <font style="white-space:nowrap">001-06439</font> </p>
<p style="margin-top:10pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10.5pt; font-family:Times New Roman" align="center">SONY GROUP CORPORATION </p>
<p style="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10.5pt; font-family:Times New Roman" align="center">(Translation of registrant’s name into English) </p>
<p style="margin-top:10pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10.5pt; font-family:Times New Roman" align="center"><font style="white-space:nowrap"><font style="white-space:nowrap">1-7-1</font></font> KONAN,
<font style="white-space:nowrap">MINATO-KU,</font> TOKYO, <font style="white-space:nowrap">108-0075,</font> JAPAN </p> <p style="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10.5pt; font-family:Times New Roman" align="center">(Address of principal
executive offices) </p> <p style="margin-top:10pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10.5pt; font-family:Times New Roman" align="center">The registrant files annual reports under cover of Form <font style="white-space:nowrap">20-F.</font> </p>
<p style="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10.5pt; font-family:Times New Roman" align="center">Indicate by check mark whether the registrant files or will file annual reports under cover of Form
<font style="white-space:nowrap">20-F</font> or Form <font style="white-space:nowrap">40-F,</font> </p> <p style="font-size:10pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt">&nbsp;</p>

thereby furnishing the information to the Commission pursuant to Rule <font style="white-space:nowrap">12g3-2(b)</font> under the Securities Exchange Act of 1934, Yes No X </p>
<p style="margin-top:10pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10.5pt; font-family:Times New Roman" align="justify">If “Yes” is marked, indicate below the file number assigned to the registrant in connection with Rule <font style="white-space:nowrap">12g3-2(b):82-</font><u>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</u> </p>
<p style="margin-top:10pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10.5pt; font-family:Times New Roman" align="justify">SIGNATURE </p> <p style="margin-top:10pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10.5pt; font-family:Times New Roman" align="justify">Pursuant to the
requirements of the Securities Exchange Act of 1934, the registrant has duly caused this report to be signed on its behalf by the undersigned, thereunto duly authorized. </p>

<p style="margin-top:1em; margin-bottom:0em; page-break-before:always">
</p><hr size="3" style="COLOR:#999999" width="100%" align="CENTER">
<h5 align="left"><a href="https://www.sec.gov/Archives/edgar/data/313838/000119312522030320/d270438d6k.htm#toc">Table of Contents</a></h5>


<center><div style="width:8.5in" align="left">

<div style="BORDER-BOTTOM:1.00pt solid #000000;BORDER-LEFT:1.00pt solid #000000;BORDER-RIGHT:1.00pt solid #000000;BORDER-TOP:1.00pt solid #000000;MARGIN-LEFT:0px; MARGIN-RIGHT:0px;max-width:100%"><div style="width:97%; margin-top:1.5%; margin-bottom:1.5%; margin-left:1.5%; margin-right:-1.25%">

 <p style="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10.5pt; font-family:Times New Roman"><b><u><a name="txcov270438_1"></a>Note for readers of this English translation </u></b></p>
<p style="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10.5pt; font-family:Times New Roman" align="justify">On February&nbsp;8, 2022, Sony Group Corporation (the “Company” or “Sony Group Corporation” and together with its
consolidated subsidiaries, “Sony” or “Sony Group”) filed its Japanese-language Quarterly Securities Report (Shihanki Houkokusho) for the three months ended December&nbsp;31, 2021 with the Director-General of the Kanto Local
Finance Bureau in Japan pursuant to the Financial Instruments and Exchange Act of Japan. This document is an English translation of the Quarterly Securities Report in its entirety, and is not intended to update the information that had been
previously filed with or submitted to the U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission (the “SEC”) in a Form <font style="white-space:nowrap">20-F,</font> Form <font style="white-space:nowrap">6-K</font> or any other form. </p>
<p style="margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10.5pt; font-family:Times New Roman"><b><u><a name="txcov270438_2"></a>Cautionary Statement </u></b></p>
<p style="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10.5pt; font-family:Times New Roman" align="justify">Statements made in this Report with respect to Sony’s current plans, estimates, strategies and beliefs and other statements that are not
historical facts are forward-looking statements about the future performance of Sony. Forward-looking statements include, but are not limited to, those statements using words such as “believe,” “expect,” “plans,”
“strategy,” “prospects,” “forecast,” “estimate,” “project,” “anticipate,” “aim,” “intend,” “seek,” “may,” “might,” “could,” or
“should,” and words of similar meaning in connection with a discussion of future operations, financial performance, events or conditions. From time to time, oral or written forward-looking statements may also be included in other materials
released to the public. These statements are based on management’s assumptions, judgments and beliefs in light of the information currently available to it. Sony cautions investors that a number of important risks and uncertainties could cause
actual results to differ materially from those discussed in the forward-looking statements, and therefore investors should not place undue reliance on them. Investors also should not rely on any obligation of Sony to update or revise any
forward-looking statements, whether as a result of new information, future events or otherwise. Sony disclaims any such obligation. Risks and uncertainties that might affect Sony include, but are not limited to: </p>
<table style="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; font-family:Times New Roman; font-size:10.5pt" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" width="100%">
<tbody><tr style="page-break-inside:avoid">
<td width="5%" valign="top" align="left">(i)</td>
<td align="left" valign="top"> <p style=" margin-top:0pt ; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10.5pt; font-family:Times New Roman; " align="justify">Sony’s ability to maintain product quality and customer satisfaction with its products and services;
</p></td></tr></tbody></table>
<table style="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; font-family:Times New Roman; font-size:10.5pt" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" width="100%">
<tbody><tr style="page-break-inside:avoid">
<td width="5%" valign="top" align="left">(ii)</td>
<td align="left" valign="top"> <p style=" margin-top:0pt ; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10.5pt; font-family:Times New Roman; " align="justify">Sony’s ability to continue to design and develop and win acceptance of, as well as achieve sufficient
cost reductions for, its products and services, including image sensors, game and network platforms, smartphones and televisions, which are offered in highly competitive markets characterized by severe price competition and continual new product and
service introductions, rapid development in technology and subjective and changing customer preferences; </p></td></tr></tbody></table>
<table style="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; font-family:Times New Roman; font-size:10.5pt" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" width="100%">
<tbody><tr style="page-break-inside:avoid">
<td width="5%" valign="top" align="left">(iii)</td>
<td align="left" valign="top"> <p style=" margin-top:0pt ; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10.5pt; font-family:Times New Roman; " align="justify">Sony’s ability to implement successful hardware, software, and content integration strategies, and to
develop and implement successful sales and distribution strategies in light of new technologies and distribution platforms; </p></td></tr></tbody></table>
<table style="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; font-family:Times New Roman; font-size:10.5pt" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" width="100%">
<tbody><tr style="page-break-inside:avoid">
<td width="5%" valign="top" align="left">(iv)</td>
<td align="left" valign="top"> <p style=" margin-top:0pt ; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10.5pt; font-family:Times New Roman; " align="justify">the effectiveness of Sony’s strategies and their execution, including but not limited to the success
of Sony’s acquisitions, joint ventures, investments, capital expenditures, restructurings and other strategic initiatives; </p></td></tr></tbody></table>
<table style="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; font-family:Times New Roman; font-size:10.5pt" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" width="100%">
<tbody><tr style="page-break-inside:avoid">
<td width="5%" valign="top" align="left">(v)</td>
<td align="left" valign="top"> <p style=" margin-top:0pt ; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10.5pt; font-family:Times New Roman; " align="justify">changes in laws, regulations and government policies in the markets in which Sony and its third-party
suppliers, service providers and business partners operate, including those related to taxation, as well as growing consumer focus on corporate social responsibility; </p></td></tr></tbody></table>
<table style="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; font-family:Times New Roman; font-size:10.5pt" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" width="100%">
<tbody><tr style="page-break-inside:avoid">
<td width="5%" valign="top" align="left">(vi)</td>
<td align="left" valign="top"> <p style=" margin-top:0pt ; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10.5pt; font-family:Times New Roman; " align="justify">Sony’s continued ability to identify the products, services and market trends with significant growth
potential, to devote sufficient resources to research and development, to prioritize investments and capital expenditures correctly and to recoup its investments and capital expenditures, including those required for technology development and
product capacity; </p></td></tr></tbody></table>
<table style="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; font-family:Times New Roman; font-size:10.5pt" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" width="100%">
<tbody><tr style="page-break-inside:avoid">
<td width="5%" valign="top" align="left">(vii)</td>
<td align="left" valign="top"> <p style=" margin-top:0pt ; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10.5pt; font-family:Times New Roman; " align="justify">Sony’s reliance on external business partners, including for the procurement of parts, components,
software and network services for its products or services, the manufacturing, marketing and distribution of its products, and its other business operations; </p></td></tr></tbody></table>
<table style="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; font-family:Times New Roman; font-size:10.5pt" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" width="100%">
<tbody><tr style="page-break-inside:avoid">
<td width="5%" valign="top" align="left">(viii)</td>
<td align="left" valign="top"> <p style=" margin-top:0pt ; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10.5pt; font-family:Times New Roman; " align="justify">the global economic and political environment in which Sony operates and the economic and political
conditions in Sony’s markets, particularly levels of consumer spending; </p></td></tr></tbody></table>
<table style="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; font-family:Times New Roman; font-size:10.5pt" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" width="100%">
<tbody><tr style="page-break-inside:avoid">
<td width="5%" valign="top" align="left">(ix)</td>
<td align="left" valign="top"> <p style=" margin-top:0pt ; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10.5pt; font-family:Times New Roman; " align="justify">Sony’s ability to meet operational and liquidity needs as a result of significant volatility and
disruption in the global financial markets or a ratings downgrade; </p></td></tr></tbody></table>
<table style="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; font-family:Times New Roman; font-size:10.5pt" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" width="100%">
<tbody><tr style="page-break-inside:avoid">
<td width="5%" valign="top" align="left">(x)</td>
<td align="left" valign="top"> <p style=" margin-top:0pt ; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10.5pt; font-family:Times New Roman; " align="justify">Sony’s ability to forecast demands, manage timely procurement and control inventories;
</p></td></tr></tbody></table>
<table style="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; font-family:Times New Roman; font-size:10.5pt" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" width="100%">
<tbody><tr style="page-break-inside:avoid">
<td width="5%" valign="top" align="left">(xi)</td>
<td align="left" valign="top"> <p style=" margin-top:0pt ; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10.5pt; font-family:Times New Roman; " align="justify">foreign exchange rates, particularly between the yen and the U.S. dollar, the euro and other currencies in
which Sony makes significant sales and incurs production costs, or in which Sony’s assets, liabilities and operating results are denominated; </p></td></tr></tbody></table>
<table style="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; font-family:Times New Roman; font-size:10.5pt" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" width="100%">

<td width="5%" valign="top" align="left">(xii)</td>
<td align="left" valign="top"> <p style=" margin-top:0pt ; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10.5pt; font-family:Times New Roman; " align="justify">Sony’s ability to recruit, retain and maintain productive relations with highly skilled personnel;
</p></td></tr></tbody></table>
<table style="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; font-family:Times New Roman; font-size:10.5pt" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" width="100%">

<td width="5%" valign="top" align="left">(xiii)</td>
<td align="left" valign="top"> <p style=" margin-top:0pt ; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10.5pt; font-family:Times New Roman; " align="justify">Sony’s ability to prevent unauthorized use or theft of intellectual property rights, to obtain or
renew licenses relating to intellectual property rights and to defend itself against claims that its products or services infringe the intellectual property rights owned by others; </p></td></tr></tbody></table>
</div></div>

<p style="margin-top:2pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10.5pt; font-family:Times New Roman" align="justify">Risks and uncertainties also include the impact of any future events with material adverse impact. The continued impact of the Coronavirus
Disease 2019 <font style="white-space:nowrap">(“COVID-19”)</font> could heighten many of the risks and uncertainties noted above. Important information regarding risks and uncertainties is also set forth in Sony’s most recent Form <font style="white-space:nowrap">20-F,</font> which is on file with the SEC. </p>

 <p style="margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt ; font-size:8pt">&nbsp;</p> <p style="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:9pt; font-family:Times New Roman" align="center">-3- </p>

<p style="margin-top:1em; margin-bottom:0em; page-break-before:always">
</p><hr size="3" style="COLOR:#999999" width="100%" align="CENTER">
<h5 align="left"><a href="https://www.sec.gov/Archives/edgar/data/313838/000119312522030320/d270438d6k.htm#toc">Table of Contents</a></h5>


<center><div style="width:8.5in" align="left">
 <p style="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10.5pt; font-family:Times New Roman"><b><a name="txcov270438_5"></a>(2) Business Overview </b></p>
<p style="margin-top:10pt; margin-bottom:0pt; margin-left:1%; margin-right:1%; text-indent:5%; font-size:10.5pt; font-family:Times New Roman" align="justify">There was no significant change in the business of Sony during the nine months ended
December 31, 2021. </p> <p style="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; margin-left:1%; margin-right:1%; text-indent:5%; font-size:10.5pt; font-family:Times New Roman" align="justify">As of December&nbsp;31, 2021, the Company had 1,495 subsidiaries
and 154 affiliated companies, of which 1,459 companies are consolidated subsidiaries (including structured entities) of the Company. The Company has applied the equity accounting method for 138 associates and joint ventures. </p>
 <p style="margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt ; font-size:8pt">&nbsp;</p> <p style="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:9pt; font-family:Times New Roman" align="center">-4- </p>

</div></center>


<p style="margin-top:1em; margin-bottom:0em; page-break-before:always">
</p><hr size="3" style="COLOR:#999999" width="100%" align="CENTER">
<h5 align="left"><a href="https://www.sec.gov/Archives/edgar/data/313838/000119312522030320/d270438d6k.htm#toc">Table of Contents</a></h5>


<center><div style="width:8.5in" align="left">
 <p style="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; margin-left:1%; font-size:10.5pt; font-family:Times New Roman"><b><a name="txcov270438_6"></a>II State of Business </b></p>
<p style="margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; margin-left:1%; font-size:10.5pt; font-family:Times New Roman"><b><a name="txcov270438_7"></a>(1) Risk Factors </b></p>
<p style="font-size:1pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt">&nbsp;</p><div style="max-width:100%;margin-left:0%; margin-right:0%;border:solid 1px;background-color:;;padding-top:2pt;padding-bottom:3pt">
<p style="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; padding-top:0pt; margin-left:1%; font-size:10.5pt; font-family:Times New Roman"><b><u>Note for readers of this English translation: </u></b></p>
<p style="margin-top:3pt; margin-bottom:0pt; margin-left:1%; margin-right:1%; text-indent:5%; font-size:10.5pt; font-family:Times New Roman" align="justify">Except for the revised risk factor below, there was no significant change from the
information presented in the Risk Factors section of the Annual Report on Form <font style="white-space:nowrap">20-F</font> filed with the Securities and Exchange Commission (the “SEC”) on June&nbsp;22, 2021. The revised risk factor below
replaces the corresponding risk factor in the Form <font style="white-space:nowrap">20-F</font> in its entirety. Any forward-looking statements included in the descriptions below are based on management’s current judgment. </p>
<p style="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; margin-left:1%; font-size:10.5pt; font-family:Times New Roman" align="justify">URL: The Annual Report on Form <font style="white-space:nowrap">20-F</font> filed with the SEC on June&nbsp;22, 2021 </p>
<p style="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; padding-bottom:0pt; margin-left:1%; font-size:10.5pt; font-family:Times New Roman" align="justify"><a href="http://www.sec.gov/Archives/edgar/data/313838/000119312521195631/d151790d20f.htm">https://www.sec.gov/Archives/edgar/data/313838/000119312521195631/d151790d20f.htm
 </a> </p></div> <p style="margin-top:18pt; margin-bottom:0pt; margin-left:1%; font-size:10.5pt; font-family:Times New Roman"><b><i>The Coronavirus Disease 2019 <font style="white-space:nowrap">(“COVID-19”)</font> pandemic has adversely
affected, and is expected to continue to adversely affect, Sony’s business operations, operating results and financial condition. </i></b></p>
<p style="margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; margin-left:1%; margin-right:1%; text-indent:5%; font-size:10.5pt; font-family:Times New Roman" align="justify">The <font style="white-space:nowrap">COVID-19</font> pandemic is adversely affecting
procurement of components and raw materials, production, development, sale and distribution of the products and services in each of Sony’s business segments, and these negative impacts are expected to continue in the future. In the fiscal year
ended March&nbsp;31, 2021, for example, in the Game&nbsp;&amp; Network Services (“G&amp;NS”) segment, there was an adverse impact on the production of hardware due to issues in the component supply chain. In the Music segment, the release
of some new music continued to be delayed around the world primarily due to artists being unable to record music, produce music videos or promote releases. Ticket and merchandising revenues decreased as
<font style="white-space:nowrap">in-person</font> concerts and other events continued to be restricted in Japan and other areas. Additionally, due to a global reduction in advertising spending, revenue from the licensing of music in TV commercials
decreased. In the Pictures segment, box office revenue was significantly impacted by the closure or limited capacity of movie theaters, and Sony was not able to release most of its already completed titles in theaters. Although the production of new
motion pictures and television shows by Sony gradually resumed, production schedules continued to be delayed. Additionally, the global reduction in advertising spending led to a decrease in advertising revenue in the Pictures segment. In the
Electronics Products&nbsp;&amp; Solutions (“EP&amp;S”) segment, certain of Sony’s manufacturing sites ceased production for a period of time pursuant to local government policy, and a portion of supply was temporarily insufficient to
meet demand. Some partner companies that supply components to several Sony businesses reduced their operations and were affected by the stoppage or delay of logistics, causing a delay in the production of some Sony products due to component
shortages. Additionally, sales decreased due to the closure of retail stores globally. In the Imaging&nbsp;&amp; Sensing Solutions (“I&amp;SS”) segment, image sensor sales decreased primarily due to a slowdown in the digital camera market,
which is a final outlet for Sony’s image sensors. In the Financial Services segment, pursuant to the announcement of a state of emergency by the Japanese government, all <font style="white-space:nowrap">in-person</font> sales activity of the
Lifeplanner<sup style="font-size:85%; vertical-align:top">®</sup> sales specialists at Sony Life Insurance Co., Ltd. (“Sony Life”) was suspended from April 2020 through May 2020. </p>
<p style="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; margin-left:1%; margin-right:1%; text-indent:5%; font-size:10.5pt; font-family:Times New Roman" align="justify">The timing and extent to which the pandemic further negatively impacts Sony’s business
could vary greatly depending on future developments, such as the possible further spread of or a resurgence in <font style="white-space:nowrap">COVID-19,</font> the timing and extent to which <font style="white-space:nowrap">COVID-19</font> declines
as well as the state of lockdowns and other measures in various geographic areas around the world and their impact on macroeconomic conditions. As a result, the impact of negative factors in each segment, such as those listed above, may continue or
become more severe. For example, with respect to the Pictures segment, the postponement and subsequent release of films by major studios could lead to the theatrical release calendar becoming crowded, increasing competition for available screen
space. This situation and the reluctance of some consumers to attend theaters could delay the recovery of sales and profit in the Pictures segment. The EP&amp;S segment could continue to be adversely impacted by factory shutdowns and supply chain
issues, and by the closure of retail stores globally. In the Financial Services segment, although Sony Life has established a system that enables remote consulting and paperless application and maintenance procedures with respect to its sales
activities, it may continue to be adversely affected by restrictions on its <font style="white-space:nowrap">in-person</font> sales activities. Much of the Sony workforce shifted to working at home during the spread of
<font style="white-space:nowrap">COVID-19</font> and is expected to continue to work at home for the time being. Although Sony takes measures to ensure that appropriate information security protections are in place for the remote workforce, there
can be no guarantee that Sony’s actions, security measures and controls designed to prevent, detect or respond to outside intrusion, limit access to data, prevent loss, destruction, alteration, or exfiltration of business information, or limit
the negative impact from such attacks can provide absolute security. </p>
 <p style="margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt ; font-size:8pt">&nbsp;</p> <p style="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:9pt; font-family:Times New Roman" align="center">-5- </p>

</div></center>


<p style="margin-top:1em; margin-bottom:0em; page-break-before:always">
</p><hr size="3" style="COLOR:#999999" width="100%" align="CENTER">
<h5 align="left"><a href="https://www.sec.gov/Archives/edgar/data/313838/000119312522030320/d270438d6k.htm#toc">Table of Contents</a></h5>


<center><div style="width:8.5in" align="left">
 <p style="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; margin-left:1%; margin-right:1%; text-indent:5%; font-size:10.5pt; font-family:Times New Roman" align="justify">The continued impact of <font style="white-space:nowrap">COVID-19</font> could heighten many of the risks and uncertainties noted below. </p>
<p style="margin-top:16pt; margin-bottom:0pt; margin-left:1%; margin-right:1%; font-size:10.5pt; font-family:Times New Roman"><b><i>Sony’s strategic initiatives, including acquisitions, joint ventures, investments, capital expenditures and
restructurings, may not be successful in achieving their strategic objectives. </i></b></p>
<p style="margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; margin-left:1%; margin-right:1%; text-indent:5%; font-size:10.5pt; font-family:Times New Roman" align="justify">Sony actively engages in acquisitions, joint ventures, capital expenditures and other
strategic investments to acquire new technologies, efficiently develop new businesses and enhance its business competitiveness. For example, in September 2020, in order to achieve further growth and strengthen governance within the financial
services business with the goal of enhancing the corporate value of the entire Sony Group, Sony acquired all of the common shares and related stock acquisition rights of Sony Financial Holdings Inc. (“SFH”) not held by Sony and made SFH a
wholly-owned subsidiary of Sony, spending 396.7&nbsp;billion yen. In addition, in the fiscal year ended March&nbsp;31, 2021, Sony invested in Bilibili Inc. (“Bilibili”) and Epic Games, Inc. (“Epic Games”), and acquired minority
interests in both companies, with the goal of accelerating business expansion in the area of entertainment. In the fiscal year ending March&nbsp;31, 2022, Sony acquired 100% of the shares and related assets of certain subsidiaries of Kobalt Music
Group Limited (“Kobalt”) relating to AWAL, Kobalt’s music distribution business mainly for independent recording artists, and Kobalt Neighbouring Rights, Kobalt’s music neighboring rights management business, for consideration of
49.8&nbsp;billion yen. Prior to the closing of the acquisition, the U.K. Competition and Markets Authority initiated a review of the transaction, and Sony continues to cooperate with such review. In addition, in the fiscal year ending March&nbsp;31,
2022, Sony made an additional strategic investment in Epic Games, acquired 100% of the equity interest in Ellation Holdings, Inc. (“Ellation”), a subsidiary of AT&amp;T Inc., which operated the anime business “Crunchyroll,” and
made a minority investment in Japan Advanced Semiconductor Manufacturing Inc., a subsidiary of Taiwan Semiconductor Manufacturing Company Limited. </p>
<p style="margin-top:8pt; margin-bottom:0pt; margin-left:1%; margin-right:1%; text-indent:5%; font-size:10.5pt; font-family:Times New Roman" align="justify">When making acquisitions, Sony’s financial results may be adversely affected by the
significant cost of the acquisition and/or integration expenses, failure to achieve synergies, failure to generate expected revenue and cost improvements, loss of key personnel and assumption of liabilities. </p>
<p style="margin-top:8pt; margin-bottom:0pt; margin-left:1%; margin-right:1%; text-indent:5%; font-size:10.5pt; font-family:Times New Roman" align="justify">When establishing joint ventures and strategic partnerships, Sony’s financial and
operating results may be adversely affected by strategic or cultural differences with partners, conflicts of interest, failure to achieve synergies, additional funding or debt guarantees required to maintain the joint venture or partnership,
requirements to buy out a joint venture partner, sell its shares or dissolve a partnership, insufficient management control including control over cash flow, loss of proprietary technology and <font style="white-space:nowrap">know-how,</font>
impairment losses and reputational harm from the actions or activities of a joint venture that uses the Sony brand. </p>
<p style="margin-top:8pt; margin-bottom:0pt; margin-left:1%; margin-right:1%; text-indent:5%; font-size:10.5pt; font-family:Times New Roman" align="justify">Sony invests heavily in production facilities and equipment, including fabrication
facilities used to make image sensors for smartphones and other products. Sony may not be able to recover these capital expenditures in part or in full or in the planned timeframe due to the competitive environment, lower-than-expected consumer
demand or changes in the financial condition or business decisions of Sony’s major customers. Sony invested 265.7&nbsp;billion yen and 180.0&nbsp;billion yen of capital in the fiscal years ended March&nbsp;31, 2020 and 2021, respectively,
mainly for the purpose of increasing image sensor production capacity. </p> <p style="margin-top:8pt; margin-bottom:0pt; margin-left:1%; margin-right:1%; text-indent:5%; font-size:10.5pt; font-family:Times New Roman" align="justify">Further, Sony is
implementing restructuring and transformation initiatives to enhance profitability, business autonomy and shareholder value and to clearly position each business within the overall business portfolio. However, the expected benefits of these
initiatives, including the expected level of profitability, may not be realized due to internal and external impediments or market conditions worsening beyond expectations. If Sony is not successful in achieving its restructuring and transformation
initiatives, Sony’s operating results, financial condition, reputation, competitiveness or profitability may be adversely affected. For example, in order to improve the profitability of its smartphone business in the EP&amp;S segment, Sony
implemented restructuring initiatives through the fiscal year ended March&nbsp;31, 2020, which included the cessation of production at its Beijing factory and the exit from several regions, such as the Middle East and Central and South America. </p>
<p style="margin-top:16pt; margin-bottom:0pt; margin-left:1%; margin-right:1%; font-size:10.5pt; font-family:Times New Roman"><b><i>Sony must manage its large volume of and widespread procurement from third-party suppliers and business partners to
control inventory levels, availability, costs and quality of parts, components, software and network services within volatile markets. </i></b></p>
<p style="margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; margin-left:1%; margin-right:1%; text-indent:5%; font-size:10.5pt; font-family:Times New Roman" align="justify">Sony’s products and services rely on a large volume of third-party suppliers and
business partners for parts, components, software and network services, including semiconductors, chipsets for PlayStation game consoles and mobile products, LCD (liquid crystal display) panels and the Android OS that is used in mobile products,
televisions and services. As a result, external suppliers’ and partners’ supply shortages, fluctuations in pricing, quality issues, discontinued support, changes in business terms or prioritization of customers outside the electronics area
or of Sony’s competitors can adversely affect Sony’s operating results, brand and reputation. For example, although Sony continues to strive to secure a necessary supply of semiconductors and other components, the global shortages of
semiconductors and other components that became pronounced in the latter half of the fiscal year ended March&nbsp;31, 2021 have continued into the third quarter of the fiscal year ending March&nbsp;31, 2022. Additionally, logistical disruptions
around the world have led to increasing lead times for procurement and shipping, resulting in an inability to adequately meet market demand for sales of hardware in the G&amp;NS segment and a wide range of products in the EP&amp;S segment. Worsened
or prolonged supply shortages may adversely affect the operating results of the G&amp;NS, EP&amp;S and I&amp;SS segments. Reliance on third-party software and technologies may make it increasingly difficult for Sony to differentiate its products
from competitors’ products. Also, shortages or delayed shipments of critical parts or components may result in a reduction or suspension of production at Sony’s or its business partners’ manufacturing sites, particularly where Sony is
substantially reliant on one supplier, where there is limited production capacity for custom parts or components, or where there are initial manufacturing capacity constraints for products, parts or components that use new technologies. </p>
 <p style="margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt ; font-size:8pt">&nbsp;</p> <p style="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:9pt; font-family:Times New Roman" align="center">-6- </p>

</div></center>


<p style="margin-top:1em; margin-bottom:0em; page-break-before:always">
</p><hr size="3" style="COLOR:#999999" width="100%" align="CENTER">
<h5 align="left"><a href="https://www.sec.gov/Archives/edgar/data/313838/000119312522030320/d270438d6k.htm#toc">Table of Contents</a></h5>


<center><div style="width:8.5in" align="left">
 <p style="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; margin-left:1%; margin-right:1%; text-indent:5%; font-size:10.5pt; font-family:Times New Roman" align="justify">Sony places orders for parts and
components in line with production and inventory plans determined in advance based on its forecast of consumer demand, which is highly volatile and difficult to predict. Inaccurate forecasts of consumer demand or inadequate business planning can
lead to a shortage or excess inventory, which can disrupt production plans and result in lost sales opportunities or inventory adjustments, respectively. Sony writes down the value of its inventory when the underlying parts, components or products
have become obsolete, when inventory levels exceed the amount expected to be used, or when the value of the inventory is otherwise recorded at a value higher than net realizable value. Such lost sales opportunities, inventory adjustments, or
shortages of parts and components have had and may have an adverse impact on Sony’s operating results and financial condition. </p>
 <p style="margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt ; font-size:8pt">&nbsp;</p> <p style="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:9pt; font-family:Times New Roman" align="center">-7- </p>

</div></center>


<p style="margin-top:1em; margin-bottom:0em; page-break-before:always">
</p><hr size="3" style="COLOR:#999999" width="100%" align="CENTER">
<h5 align="left"><a href="https://www.sec.gov/Archives/edgar/data/313838/000119312522030320/d270438d6k.htm#toc">Table of Contents</a></h5>


<center><div style="width:8.5in" align="left">
 <p style="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; margin-left:1%; font-size:10.5pt; font-family:Times New Roman"><b><a name="txcov270438_8"></a>(2) Management’s Discussion and Analysis of Financial
Condition, Results of Operations and Status of Cash Flows </b></p> <p style="margin-top:3pt; margin-bottom:0pt; margin-left:1%; font-size:10.5pt; font-family:Times New Roman" align="justify">i) Results of Operations </p>
<p style="margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; margin-left:1%; margin-right:1%; text-indent:5%; font-size:10.5pt; font-family:Times New Roman" align="justify">Sony adopted IFRS starting in the three months ended June&nbsp;30, 2021, in lieu of the
previously applied generally accepted accounting principles in the United States (“U.S. GAAP”). The results for the nine months ended December&nbsp;31, 2020 and for the fiscal year ended March&nbsp;31, 2021 are also presented in accordance
with IFRS for the purpose of comparative analysis. </p> <p style="margin-top:10pt; margin-bottom:0pt; margin-left:1%; margin-right:1%; text-indent:5%; font-size:10.5pt; font-family:Times New Roman" align="justify">For details of adjustments made in
accordance with the transition from U.S. GAAP to IFRS, please refer to “IV Financial Statements – Notes to Condensed Consolidated Financial Statements - 14. First-time adoption.” </p>
<p style="margin-top:10pt; margin-bottom:0pt; margin-left:1%; margin-right:1%; text-indent:5%; font-size:10.5pt; font-family:Times New Roman" align="justify">Due to organizational changes as of April&nbsp;1, 2021, from the three months ended
June&nbsp;30, 2021, Sony transferred some of the businesses and functions previously included within All Other and Corporate and elimination to the EP&amp;S segment. Sales and operating income (loss) of each segment for the fiscal year ended
March&nbsp;31, 2021 are presented to conform to the organizational structure for the fiscal year ending March&nbsp;31, 2022. </p>
<p style="margin-top:10pt; margin-bottom:0pt; margin-left:1%; margin-right:1%; text-indent:5%; font-size:10.5pt; font-family:Times New Roman" align="justify">All amounts are presented in accordance with IFRS. “Sales and Financial Services
revenue” (“sales”) in each business segment represents sales recorded before intersegment transactions are eliminated. “Operating income (loss)” in each business segment represents operating income (loss) reported before
intersegment transactions are eliminated and excludes unallocated corporate expenses. For details regarding each segment’s product categories, please refer to “IV Financial Statements - Notes to Condensed Consolidated Financial Statements
- 13. Business segment information.” </p> <p style="margin-top:10pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:1%; font-size:10.5pt; font-family:Times New Roman" align="justify">Consolidated Financial Results </p>

(“the current nine months”) increased 895.5&nbsp;billion yen compared to the same period of the previous fiscal year <font style="white-space:nowrap"><font style="white-space:nowrap">(“year-on-year”)</font></font> to 7 trillion
657.5&nbsp;billion yen. This significant increase was primarily due to significant increases in sales in the Pictures, EP&amp;S and Music segments. </p>
<p style="margin-top:10pt; margin-bottom:0pt; margin-left:1%; margin-right:1%; text-indent:5%; font-size:10.5pt; font-family:Times New Roman" align="justify">Operating income in the current nine months increased 174.9&nbsp;billion yen <font style="white-space:nowrap"><font style="white-space:nowrap">year-on-year</font></font> to 1 trillion 63.7&nbsp;billion yen. This increase was primarily due to significant increases in operating income in the Pictures and EP&amp;S segments, partially
offset by decreases in operating income in the G&amp;NS and Financial Services segments. </p> <p style="margin-top:10pt; margin-bottom:0pt; margin-left:1%; text-indent:5%; font-size:10.5pt; font-family:Times New Roman" align="justify">Operating
income for the current nine months included the following: </p>

 <p style="margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt ; font-size:8pt">&nbsp;</p> <p style="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:9pt; font-family:Times New Roman" align="center">-8- </p>

</div></center>


<p style="margin-top:1em; margin-bottom:0em; page-break-before:always">
</p><hr size="3" style="COLOR:#999999" width="100%" align="CENTER">
<h5 align="left"><a href="https://www.sec.gov/Archives/edgar/data/313838/000119312522030320/d270438d6k.htm#toc">Table of Contents</a></h5>


<center><div style="width:8.5in" align="left">
 <p style="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; margin-left:1%; text-indent:5%; font-size:10.5pt; font-family:Times New Roman" align="justify">The share of profit (loss) of investments accounted for
using the equity method in the current nine months, recorded within operating income, increased 13.5&nbsp;billion yen <font style="white-space:nowrap"><font style="white-space:nowrap">year-on-year</font></font> to 20.1&nbsp;billion yen. This
increase was mainly due to an increase in the share of profit of the investment in M3. </p> <p style="margin-top:10pt; margin-bottom:0pt; margin-left:1%; text-indent:5%; font-size:10.5pt; font-family:Times New Roman" align="justify">The net effect
of financial income and expenses was an expense of 35.8&nbsp;billion yen, compared to income of 67.2&nbsp;billion yen in the same period of the previous fiscal year. This was primarily due to the recording of unrealized losses mainly on Sony’s
shares of Spotify Technology S.A. in the current nine months, compared to the recording of unrealized gains on such shares in the same period of the previous fiscal year. For details, please refer to “IV Financial Statements - Notes to
Condensed Consolidated Financial Statements - 4. Financial instruments.” </p> <p style="margin-top:10pt; margin-bottom:0pt; margin-left:1%; text-indent:5%; font-size:10.5pt; font-family:Times New Roman" align="justify">Income before income
taxes increased 71.8&nbsp;billion yen <font style="white-space:nowrap"><font style="white-space:nowrap">year-on-year</font></font> to 1 trillion 27.9&nbsp;billion yen. </p>
<p style="margin-top:10pt; margin-bottom:0pt; margin-left:1%; text-indent:5%; font-size:10.5pt; font-family:Times New Roman" align="justify">During the current nine months, Sony recorded income tax expense of 252.4&nbsp;billion yen, resulting in an
effective tax rate of 24.6%, which was higher than the effective tax rate of negative 2.2% in the same period of the previous fiscal year. This higher effective tax rate was mainly due to the fact that, in the nine months ended December&nbsp;31,
2020, the reversal of a previous write-down of a significant portion of the deferred tax assets of the consolidated tax filing group in Japan resulted in a tax benefit of 214.3&nbsp;billion yen and the reversal of a previous write-down of the
deferred tax assets for certain research and development credits of the consolidated tax filing group in the United States resulted in a tax benefit of 13.6&nbsp;billion yen. </p>
<p style="margin-top:10pt; margin-bottom:0pt; margin-left:1%; text-indent:5%; font-size:10.5pt; font-family:Times New Roman" align="justify">Net income attributable to Sony Group Corporation’s stockholders decreased 191.8&nbsp;billion yen <font style="white-space:nowrap"><font style="white-space:nowrap">year-on-year</font></font> to 771.1&nbsp;billion yen. </p>
<p style="margin-top:10pt; margin-bottom:0pt; margin-left:1%; text-indent:5%; font-size:10.5pt; font-family:Times New Roman" align="justify">Operating performance by business segment for the current nine months is as follows: </p>
<p style="margin-top:18pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10.5pt; font-family:Times New Roman"><b><u>Game&nbsp;&amp; Network Services (G&amp;NS) </u></b></p>
<p style="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; margin-left:1%; text-indent:5%; font-size:10.5pt; font-family:Times New Roman" align="justify">Sales increased 78.5&nbsp;billion yen
<font style="white-space:nowrap"><font style="white-space:nowrap">year-on-year</font></font> to 2 trillion 74.5&nbsp;billion yen. This increase in sales was mainly due to an increase in
PlayStation<sup style="font-size:85%; vertical-align:top">®</sup>5 hardware unit sales as well as the impact of foreign exchange rates, partially offset primarily by a decrease in game software sales including
<font style="white-space:nowrap">add-on</font> content and a decrease in PlayStation<sup style="font-size:85%; vertical-align:top">®</sup>4 hardware unit sales. Operating income decreased 51.2&nbsp;billion yen <font style="white-space:nowrap"><font style="white-space:nowrap">year-on-year</font></font> to 258.8&nbsp;billion yen. This decrease was primarily due to the impact of the above-mentioned decrease in game software sales, partially offset primarily by the positive impact of foreign
exchange rates. </p> <p style="margin-top:18pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10.5pt; font-family:Times New Roman"><b><u>Music </u></b></p>
<p style="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; margin-left:1%; text-indent:5%; font-size:10.5pt; font-family:Times New Roman" align="justify">The Music segment results include the <font style="white-space:nowrap">yen-based</font> results of Sony Music
Entertainment (Japan) Inc. and the <font style="white-space:nowrap">yen-translated</font> results of Sony Music Entertainment (“SME”) and Sony Music Publishing LLC (“SMP”), which aggregate the results of their worldwide
subsidiaries on a U.S. dollar basis. </p> <p style="margin-top:10pt; margin-bottom:0pt; margin-left:1%; text-indent:5%; font-size:10.5pt; font-family:Times New Roman" align="justify">Sales increased 149.9&nbsp;billion yen <font style="white-space:nowrap"><font style="white-space:nowrap">year-on-year</font></font> to 822.4&nbsp;billion yen. This significant increase in sales was primarily due to increases in sales for Recorded Music and Music Publishing, resulting from
higher revenue from paid subscription streaming services as well as advertising-supported streaming services which were impacted by <font style="white-space:nowrap">COVID-19</font> in the same period of the previous fiscal year. Operating income
increased 12.1&nbsp;billion yen <font style="white-space:nowrap"><font style="white-space:nowrap">year-on-year</font></font> to 161.1&nbsp;billion yen, primarily due to the impact of the above-mentioned significant increase in sales, partially
offset by the absence of a 7.2&nbsp;billion yen gain on the sale of a portion of shares of Pledis and a 5.9&nbsp;billion yen gain in connection with the transfer of an overseas business, both of which were recorded in the same period of the previous
fiscal year. </p> <p style="margin-top:18pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10.5pt; font-family:Times New Roman"><b><u>Pictures </u></b></p>
<p style="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; margin-left:1%; text-indent:5%; font-size:10.5pt; font-family:Times New Roman" align="justify">The Pictures segment results are the <font style="white-space:nowrap">yen-translated</font> results of Sony
Pictures Entertainment Inc. (“SPE”), which aggregates the results of its worldwide subsidiaries on a U.S. dollar basis. Management analyzes the results of SPE in U.S. dollars, so discussion of certain portions of its results is specified
as being on “a U.S. dollar basis.” </p> <p style="margin-top:10pt; margin-bottom:0pt; margin-left:1%; text-indent:5%; font-size:10.5pt; font-family:Times New Roman" align="justify">Sales increased 373.9&nbsp;billion yen, a 68% increase <font style="white-space:nowrap"><font style="white-space:nowrap">year-on-year</font></font> (a 59% increase on a U.S. dollar basis), to 926.7&nbsp;billion yen. This significant increase in sales was due to higher sales in all categories. Sales for Motion
Pictures increased primarily due to higher theatrical revenues as a result of the contribution of <i><font style="white-space:nowrap">Spider-Man:</font> No Way Home</i>,<i> </i>as well as higher licensing revenues from digital streaming networks for
new film titles and higher licensing revenues for catalog product. This was partially offset by lower home entertainment and licensing revenues generated from prior year releases in the current nine months, due to the absence of significant
theatrical releases in the previous fiscal year. Sales for Television Productions increased primarily due to the recording of revenues from the licensing of <i>Seinfeld</i> as well as an increase in deliveries of current year titles, as the previous
fiscal year was negatively impacted by production delays due to <font style="white-space:nowrap">COVID-19.</font> Sales for Media Networks increased primarily due to the impact of the acquisition of Crunchyroll. Operating income significantly
increased 126.2&nbsp;billion yen <font style="white-space:nowrap"><font style="white-space:nowrap">year-on-year</font></font> to 206.4&nbsp;billion yen. This increase was primarily due to the recording of a 70.2&nbsp;billion yen gain from the
transfer of GSN Games, a division of Game Show Network, LLC, and the impact of the above-mentioned increase in sales, partially offset by the impact of higher marketing expenses for current year theatrical releases in Motion Pictures. </p>
 <p style="margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt ; font-size:8pt">&nbsp;</p> <p style="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:9pt; font-family:Times New Roman" align="center">-9- </p>

</div></center>


<p style="margin-top:1em; margin-bottom:0em; page-break-before:always">
</p><hr size="3" style="COLOR:#999999" width="100%" align="CENTER">
<h5 align="left"><a href="https://www.sec.gov/Archives/edgar/data/313838/000119312522030320/d270438d6k.htm#toc">Table of Contents</a></h5>


<center><div style="width:8.5in" align="left">
 <p style="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10.5pt; font-family:Times New Roman"><b><u>Electronics Products&nbsp;&amp; Solutions (EP&amp;S) </u></b></p>
<p style="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; margin-left:1%; text-indent:5%; font-size:10.5pt; font-family:Times New Roman" align="justify">Sales increased 251.3&nbsp;billion yen
<font style="white-space:nowrap"><font style="white-space:nowrap">year-on-year</font></font> to 1 trillion 845.1&nbsp;billion yen. This significant increase in sales was mainly due to an improvement in the product mix of televisions and digital
cameras as well as the impact of foreign exchange rates. Operating income significantly increased 76.6&nbsp;billion yen <font style="white-space:nowrap"><font style="white-space:nowrap">year-on-year</font></font> to 224.5&nbsp;billion yen, due to an
improvement in the product mix of digital cameras and televisions as well as the positive impact of foreign exchange rates. </p> <p style="margin-top:18pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10.5pt; font-family:Times New Roman"><b><u>Imaging&nbsp;&amp;
Sensing Solutions (I&amp;SS) </u></b></p> <p style="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; margin-left:1%; text-indent:5%; font-size:10.5pt; font-family:Times New Roman" align="justify">Sales increased 40.8&nbsp;billion yen <font style="white-space:nowrap"><font style="white-space:nowrap">year-on-year</font></font> to 821.1&nbsp;billion yen. This increase in sales was mainly due to an increase in unit sales of image sensors for mobile products despite a deterioration in the
product mix, an increase in unit sales of image sensors for digital cameras as a result of recovery from the impact of <font style="white-space:nowrap">COVID-19,</font> as well as the impact of foreign exchange rates. Operating income increased
16.5&nbsp;billion yen <font style="white-space:nowrap"><font style="white-space:nowrap">year-on-year</font></font> to 144.9&nbsp;billion yen. This increase was mainly due to the impact of the above-mentioned increase in sales, the positive impact of
foreign exchange rates, and the absence of the 9.0&nbsp;billion yen of inventory write-downs recorded in the same period of the previous fiscal year for certain image sensors for mobile products whose shipments were suspended as a result of U.S.
export restrictions, partially offset by an increase in research and development expenses as well as depreciation and amortization expenses. </p>
<p style="margin-top:18pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10.5pt; font-family:Times New Roman"><b><u>Financial Services </u></b></p>
<p style="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; margin-left:1%; text-indent:5%; font-size:10.5pt; font-family:Times New Roman" align="justify">The Financial Services segment results include Sony Financial Group Inc. (“SFGI,” whose company
name was changed from SFH as of October&nbsp;1, 2021) and SFGI’s consolidated subsidiaries such as Sony Life, Sony Assurance Inc. (“Sony Assurance”), and Sony Bank Inc. (“Sony Bank”). The results of Sony Life discussed in
the Financial Services segment differ from the results that SFGI and Sony Life disclose separately on a Japanese statutory basis. </p>
<p style="margin-top:10pt; margin-bottom:0pt; margin-left:1%; text-indent:5%; font-size:10.5pt; font-family:Times New Roman" align="justify">Financial services revenue increased 19.8&nbsp;billion yen <font style="white-space:nowrap"><font style="white-space:nowrap">year-on-year</font></font> to 1 trillion 254.1&nbsp;billion yen, mainly due to an increase in revenue at Sony Life. Revenue at Sony Life increased 36.5&nbsp;billion yen<sup style="font-size:85%; vertical-align:top">*</sup>
<font style="white-space:nowrap"><font style="white-space:nowrap">year-on-year</font></font> to 1 trillion 119.9&nbsp;billion yen due to increases in insurance premium revenue and gains on investments in the general account, partially offset by a
decrease in net gains on investments in the separate accounts. Operating income decreased 10.6&nbsp;billion yen <font style="white-space:nowrap"><font style="white-space:nowrap">year-on-year</font></font> to 102.3&nbsp;billion yen, primarily due to
the recording of a <font style="white-space:nowrap">one-time</font> loss of 16.8&nbsp;billion yen at a subsidiary of Sony Life and decreases in operating income at Sony Bank and Sony Assurance, partially offset by an increase in operating income at
Sony Life. Operating income at Sony Life increased 19.5&nbsp;billion yen <font style="white-space:nowrap"><font style="white-space:nowrap">year-on-year</font></font> to 104.7&nbsp;billion yen, mainly due to a decrease in expenses for various
provisions related to <font style="white-space:nowrap">COVID-19</font> and an increase in insurance premium revenue reflecting an increase in the policy amount in force. Operating income at Sony Bank decreased due to a deterioration in valuation
gains and losses on securities, and operating income at Sony Assurance decreased due to an increase in the loss ratio for automobile insurance. </p>
<p style="margin-top:10pt; margin-bottom:0pt; margin-left:1%; font-size:10.5pt; font-family:Times New Roman" align="justify">*<sup style="font-size:85%; vertical-align:top"> </sup>Sony Life merged with its subsidiary which is engaged in the annuity
business as of April&nbsp;1, 2021. Due to the merger, from the fiscal year ending March&nbsp;31, 2022, the revenue at this subsidiary is included in the revenue at Sony Life. Excluding the impact of this merger, revenue at Sony Life increased
7.4&nbsp;billion yen <font style="white-space:nowrap"><font style="white-space:nowrap">year-on-year.</font></font> </p>
 <p style="margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt ; font-size:8pt">&nbsp;</p> <p style="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:9pt; font-family:Times New Roman" align="center">-10- </p>

</div></center>


<p style="margin-top:1em; margin-bottom:0em; page-break-before:always">
</p><hr size="3" style="COLOR:#999999" width="100%" align="CENTER">
<h5 align="left"><a href="https://www.sec.gov/Archives/edgar/data/313838/000119312522030320/d270438d6k.htm#toc">Table of Contents</a></h5>


<center><div style="width:8.5in" align="left">
 <p style="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10.5pt; font-family:Times New Roman"><u>Operating Performance by Geographic Area </u></p>
<p style="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; margin-left:1%; text-indent:5%; font-size:10.5pt; font-family:Times New Roman" align="justify">For operating performance by geographic area, please refer to “sales and operating revenue attributed to
countries and areas based on location of external customers” in “IV Financial Statements – Notes to Condensed Consolidated Financial Statements - 13. Business segment information.” </p>
 <p style="margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt ; font-size:8pt">&nbsp;</p> <p style="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:9pt; font-family:Times New Roman" align="center">-11- </p>

</div></center>


<p style="margin-top:1em; margin-bottom:0em; page-break-before:always">
</p><hr size="3" style="COLOR:#999999" width="100%" align="CENTER">
<h5 align="left"><a href="https://www.sec.gov/Archives/edgar/data/313838/000119312522030320/d270438d6k.htm#toc">Table of Contents</a></h5>


<center><div style="width:8.5in" align="left">
 <p style="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10.5pt; font-family:Times New Roman" align="justify"><u>Foreign Exchange Fluctuations and Risk Hedging </u></p>
<p style="font-size:3pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt">&nbsp;</p><div style="max-width:100%;margin-left:0%; margin-right:0%;border:solid 1px;background-color:;;padding-top:2pt;padding-bottom:3pt">
<p style="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; padding-top:0pt; margin-left:1%; font-size:10.5pt; font-family:Times New Roman"><b><u>Note for readers of this English translation: </u></b></p>
<p style="margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; margin-left:1%; margin-right:1%; text-indent:5%; font-size:10.5pt; font-family:Times New Roman" align="justify">Except for the information set forth below, there was no significant change from the
information presented in the Foreign Exchange Fluctuations and Risk Hedging section of the Annual Report on Form <font style="white-space:nowrap">20-F</font> filed with the SEC on June&nbsp;22, 2021. Although foreign exchange rates have fluctuated
during the nine-month period ended December&nbsp;31, 2021, there has been no significant change in Sony’s risk hedging policy as described in the Annual Report on Form <font style="white-space:nowrap">20-F.</font> </p>
<p style="margin-top:9pt; margin-bottom:0pt; margin-left:1%; font-size:10.5pt; font-family:Times New Roman" align="justify">URL: The Annual Report on Form <font style="white-space:nowrap">20-F</font> filed with the SEC on June&nbsp;22, 2021 </p>
<p style="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; padding-bottom:0pt; margin-left:1%; font-size:10.5pt; font-family:Times New Roman" align="justify"><a href="http://www.sec.gov/Archives/edgar/data/313838/000119312521195631/d151790d20f.htm">https://www.sec.gov/Archives/edgar/data/313838/000119312521195631/d151790d20f.htm
 </a> </p></div> <p style="margin-top:10pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:5%; font-size:10.5pt; font-family:Times New Roman" align="justify">During the current nine months, the average rates of the yen were 111.1 yen against the U.S. dollar and
130.6 yen against the euro, which were 5.0 yen and 8.2 yen lower <font style="white-space:nowrap"><font style="white-space:nowrap">year-on-year,</font></font> respectively. </p>
<p style="margin-top:10pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:5%; font-size:10.5pt; font-family:Times New Roman" align="justify">For the current nine months, sales were 7 trillion 657.5&nbsp;billion yen, an increase of 13%
<font style="white-space:nowrap"><font style="white-space:nowrap">year-on-year,</font></font> while on a constant currency basis, sales increased approximately 9%
<font style="white-space:nowrap"><font style="white-space:nowrap">year-on-year.</font></font> For further details about the impact of foreign exchange rate fluctuations on sales and operating income, please refer to the Note below. </p>
<p style="margin-top:10pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:5%; font-size:10.5pt; font-family:Times New Roman" align="justify">Consolidated operating income increased 174.9&nbsp;billion yen <font style="white-space:nowrap"><font style="white-space:nowrap">year-on-year</font></font> to 1 trillion 63.7&nbsp;billion yen for the current nine months. Most of the foreign exchange rate impact was attributable to the impact of foreign exchange rates in the G&amp;NS, EP&amp;S and
I&amp;SS segments. </p> <p style="margin-top:10pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:5%; font-size:10.5pt; font-family:Times New Roman" align="justify">The table below indicates the impact of changes in foreign exchange rates on sales and operating
results of each of the above-mentioned three segments. Also, please refer to the “Results of Operations” section, which discusses the impact of foreign exchange rates within segments and categories where foreign exchange rate fluctuations
had a significant impact. </p> <p style="font-size:10pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt">&nbsp;</p>
<table cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" width="68%" border="0" style="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; font-family:Times New Roman; font-size:10.5pt">

<td valign="top" style="BORDER-BOTTOM:1px solid #000000" bgcolor="#cceeff">&nbsp;</td>

<td valign="bottom" bgcolor="#cceeff" style=" BORDER-BOTTOM:1px solid #000000">&nbsp;&nbsp;</td>
<td valign="bottom" style="BORDER-BOTTOM:1px solid #000000" bgcolor="#cceeff">&nbsp;</td>
<td valign="bottom" style="BORDER-BOTTOM:1px solid #000000" bgcolor="#cceeff" align="right">310.0</td>
<td nowrap="" valign="bottom" style="BORDER-BOTTOM:1px solid #000000" bgcolor="#cceeff">&nbsp;</td>
<td valign="bottom" bgcolor="#cceeff" style=" BORDER-BOTTOM:1px solid #000000">&nbsp;&nbsp;</td>
<td valign="bottom" style="BORDER-BOTTOM:1px solid #000000" bgcolor="#cceeff"><b>&nbsp;</b></td>
<td valign="bottom" style="BORDER-BOTTOM:1px solid #000000" bgcolor="#cceeff" align="right"><b>258.8&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</b></td>
<td nowrap="" valign="bottom" style="BORDER-BOTTOM:1px solid #000000" bgcolor="#cceeff"><b>&nbsp;</b></td>
<td valign="bottom" bgcolor="#cceeff" style=" BORDER-BOTTOM:1px solid #000000">&nbsp;&nbsp;</td>
<td valign="bottom" align="center" style="BORDER-BOTTOM:1px solid #000000" bgcolor="#cceeff">&nbsp;+15.2</td></tr>
<tr style="page-break-inside:avoid ; font-family:Times New Roman; font-size:10.5pt">
<td valign="top"> <p style=" margin-top:0pt ; margin-bottom:0pt; margin-left:1.00em; text-indent:-1.00em; font-size:10.5pt; font-family:Times New Roman">&nbsp;&nbsp;EP&amp;S</p></td>
<td valign="bottom">&nbsp;&nbsp;</td>

<td valign="bottom" bgcolor="#cceeff">&nbsp;&nbsp;</td>

<td valign="bottom" bgcolor="#cceeff">&nbsp;&nbsp;</td>

<td valign="top" style="BORDER-BOTTOM:1px solid #000000" bgcolor="#cceeff">&nbsp;</td>

<td valign="bottom" style="BORDER-BOTTOM:1px solid #000000" bgcolor="#cceeff">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Operating income</td>

<td valign="bottom" style="BORDER-BOTTOM:1px solid #000000" bgcolor="#cceeff" align="right">128.3</td>
<td nowrap="" valign="bottom" style="BORDER-BOTTOM:1px solid #000000" bgcolor="#cceeff">&nbsp;</td>
<td valign="bottom" bgcolor="#cceeff" style=" BORDER-BOTTOM:1px solid #000000">&nbsp;&nbsp;</td>
<td valign="bottom" style="BORDER-BOTTOM:1px solid #000000" bgcolor="#cceeff"><b>&nbsp;</b></td>
<td valign="bottom" style="BORDER-BOTTOM:1px solid #000000" bgcolor="#cceeff" align="right"><b>144.9&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</b></td>
<td nowrap="" valign="bottom" style="BORDER-BOTTOM:1px solid #000000" bgcolor="#cceeff"><b>&nbsp;</b></td>
<td valign="bottom" bgcolor="#cceeff" style=" BORDER-BOTTOM:1px solid #000000">&nbsp;&nbsp;</td>
<td valign="bottom" align="center" style="BORDER-BOTTOM:1px solid #000000" bgcolor="#cceeff">&nbsp;+9.8</td></tr>
</tbody></table> <p style="margin-top:10pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:5%; font-size:10.5pt; font-family:Times New Roman" align="justify">In addition, sales for the Music segment increased 22% <font style="white-space:nowrap"><font style="white-space:nowrap">year-on-year</font></font> to 822.4&nbsp;billion yen, an approximate 18% increase on a constant currency basis. In the Pictures segment, sales increased 68%
<font style="white-space:nowrap"><font style="white-space:nowrap">year-on-year</font></font> to 926.7&nbsp;billion yen, an approximate 59% increase on a U.S. dollar basis. As most of the operations in Sony’s Financial Services segment are based
in Japan, Sony’s management analyzes the performance of the Financial Services segment on a yen basis only. </p> <p style="margin-top:10pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10.5pt; font-family:Times New Roman" align="justify"><u>Note: </u></p>
<p style="margin-top:10pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10.5pt; font-family:Times New Roman" align="justify"><u>Sales on a Constant Currency Basis and the Impact of Foreign Exchange Rate Fluctuations </u></p>
<p style="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:5%; font-size:10.5pt; font-family:Times New Roman" align="justify">The descriptions of sales on a constant currency basis reflect sales calculated by applying the yen’s monthly average
exchange rates from the same period of the previous fiscal year to local currency-denominated monthly sales in the relevant period of the current fiscal year. For SME and SMP in the Music segment, the constant currency amounts are calculated by
applying the monthly average U.S. dollar / yen exchange rates after aggregation on a U.S. dollar basis. </p> <p style="margin-top:10pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:5%; font-size:10.5pt; font-family:Times New Roman" align="justify">Results for the
Pictures segment are described on a U.S. dollar basis as the Pictures segment reflects the operations of SPE, a U.S.-based operation that aggregates the results of its worldwide subsidiaries in U.S. dollars. </p>
 <p style="margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt ; font-size:8pt">&nbsp;</p> <p style="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:9pt; font-family:Times New Roman" align="center">-12- </p>

</div></center>


<p style="margin-top:1em; margin-bottom:0em; page-break-before:always">
</p><hr size="3" style="COLOR:#999999" width="100%" align="CENTER">
<h5 align="left"><a href="https://www.sec.gov/Archives/edgar/data/313838/000119312522030320/d270438d6k.htm#toc">Table of Contents</a></h5>


<center><div style="width:8.5in" align="left">
 <p style="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:5%; font-size:10.5pt; font-family:Times New Roman" align="justify">The impact of foreign exchange rate fluctuations on sales is calculated by
applying the change in the yen’s periodic weighted average exchange rate for the same period of the previous fiscal year from the relevant period of the current fiscal year to the major transactional currencies in which the sales are
denominated. The impact of foreign exchange rate fluctuations on operating income (loss) is calculated by subtracting from the impact on sales the impact on cost of sales and selling, general and administrative expenses calculated by applying the
same major transactional currencies calculation process to cost of sales and selling, general and administrative expenses as for the impact on sales. The I&amp;SS segment enters into its own foreign exchange hedging transactions, and the impact of
those transactions is included in the impact of foreign exchange rate fluctuations on operating income (loss) for that segment. </p>
<p style="margin-top:10pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:5%; font-size:10.5pt; font-family:Times New Roman" align="justify">This information is not a substitute for Sony’s consolidated financial statements measured in accordance with IFRS.
However, Sony believes that these disclosures provide additional useful analytical information to investors regarding the operating performance of Sony. </p>
 <p style="margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt ; font-size:8pt">&nbsp;</p> <p style="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:9pt; font-family:Times New Roman" align="center">-13- </p>

</div></center>


<p style="margin-top:1em; margin-bottom:0em; page-break-before:always">
</p><hr size="3" style="COLOR:#999999" width="100%" align="CENTER">
<h5 align="left"><a href="https://www.sec.gov/Archives/edgar/data/313838/000119312522030320/d270438d6k.htm#toc">Table of Contents</a></h5>


<center><div style="width:8.5in" align="left">
 <p style="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10.5pt; font-family:Times New Roman"><u>Status of Cash Flows<sup style="font-size:85%; vertical-align:top">*</sup> </u></p>
<p style="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:5%; font-size:10.5pt; font-family:Times New Roman" align="justify">Operating Activities: Net cash inflow from operating activities during the current nine months was 808.6&nbsp;billion yen, a
decrease of 150.8&nbsp;billion yen <font style="white-space:nowrap"><font style="white-space:nowrap">year-on-year.</font></font> </p>
<p style="margin-top:10pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:5%; font-size:10.5pt; font-family:Times New Roman" align="justify">For all segments excluding the Financial Services segment, there was a net cash inflow of 565.8&nbsp;billion yen, a decrease
of 358.6&nbsp;billion yen <font style="white-space:nowrap"><font style="white-space:nowrap">year-on-year.</font></font> This decrease was primarily due to a larger
<font style="white-space:nowrap"><font style="white-space:nowrap">year-on-year</font></font> increase in inventories and content assets, a smaller increase in trade payables and an increase in payments of income taxes, partially offset by the
positive impact of a <font style="white-space:nowrap"><font style="white-space:nowrap">year-on-year</font></font> increase in income before income tax after taking into account <font style="white-space:nowrap">non-cash</font> adjustments (including
depreciation and amortization, including amortization of contract costs, other operating (income) expense, net and (gain) loss on securities, net). </p>
<p style="margin-top:10pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:5%; font-size:10.5pt; font-family:Times New Roman" align="justify">The Financial Services segment had a net cash inflow of 282.2&nbsp;billion yen, an increase of 227.3&nbsp;billion yen <font style="white-space:nowrap"><font style="white-space:nowrap">year-on-year.</font></font> This increase was mainly due to a smaller <font style="white-space:nowrap"><font style="white-space:nowrap">year-on-year</font></font> increase in investments
and advances in the financial services business, partially offset by a smaller increase in deposits from customers at Sony Bank. </p>
<p style="margin-top:10pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:5%; font-size:10.5pt; font-family:Times New Roman" align="justify">Investing Activities: During the current nine months, Sony used 523.2&nbsp;billion yen of net cash in investing activities,
an increase of 92.3&nbsp;billion yen <font style="white-space:nowrap"><font style="white-space:nowrap">year-on-year.</font></font> </p>
<p style="margin-top:10pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:5%; font-size:10.5pt; font-family:Times New Roman" align="justify">For all segments excluding the Financial Services segment, there was a 510.4&nbsp;billion yen net cash outflow, an increase
of 93.6&nbsp;billion yen <font style="white-space:nowrap"><font style="white-space:nowrap">year-on-year.</font></font> This increase was mainly due to payments for the purchase of the equity interest in Ellation, which operates the anime business
“Crunchyroll,” the purchase of shares and related assets of certain subsidiaries of Kobalt and an additional investment in Epic Games, partially offset by the cash inflow from the transfer of GSN Games, a division of Game Show Network,
LLC, and a <font style="white-space:nowrap"><font style="white-space:nowrap">year-on-year</font></font> decrease in payments for fixed asset purchases. Additionally, the same period of the previous fiscal year included a payment for an investment in
Bilibili. </p> <p style="margin-top:10pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:5%; font-size:10.5pt; font-family:Times New Roman" align="justify">The Financial Services segment used 12.8&nbsp;billion yen of net cash in investing activities, essentially
flat <font style="white-space:nowrap"><font style="white-space:nowrap">year-on-year.</font></font> </p> <p style="margin-top:10pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:5%; font-size:10.5pt; font-family:Times New Roman" align="justify">Financing
Activities: Net cash outflow from financing activities during the current nine months was 278.7&nbsp;billion yen, an increase of 144.3&nbsp;billion yen <font style="white-space:nowrap"><font style="white-space:nowrap">year-on-year.</font></font>
</p> <p style="margin-top:10pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:5%; font-size:10.5pt; font-family:Times New Roman" align="justify">For all segments excluding the Financial Services segment, there was a 270.7&nbsp;billion yen net cash outflow, an
increase of 154.5&nbsp;billion yen <font style="white-space:nowrap"><font style="white-space:nowrap">year-on-year.</font></font> This increase was primarily due to the redemption of straight bonds, an increase in dividend payments and payments for
the repurchase of Sony’s own common stock (4,141,700 shares for a total purchase price of 50.2&nbsp;billion yen, as of December&nbsp;31, 2021) which was approved at a meeting of the Board of Directors held on April&nbsp;28, 2021. The same
period of the previous fiscal year included the procurement of approximately 2&nbsp;billion U.S. dollars in the form of a long-term bank loan. Additionally, the same period of the previous fiscal year included a total of 396.5&nbsp;billion yen in
short-term bank borrowings to fund the acquisition of all of the shares of SFGI and the related stock acquisition rights for 396.7&nbsp;billion yen, in order to make SFGI into a wholly-owned subsidiary of Sony Group Corporation. Of these borrowings,
which were secured in July and October 2020, 200.0&nbsp;billion yen was repaid in December 2020. </p> <p style="margin-top:10pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:5%; font-size:10.5pt; font-family:Times New Roman" align="justify">In the Financial
Services segment, there was a 47.3&nbsp;billion yen net cash outflow, an increase of 9.3&nbsp;billion yen <font style="white-space:nowrap"><font style="white-space:nowrap">year-on-year.</font></font> This increase was mainly due to an increase in
dividend payments. </p> <p style="margin-top:10pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:5%; font-size:10.5pt; font-family:Times New Roman" align="justify">Total Cash and Cash Equivalents: Accounting for the above factors and the effect of fluctuations in
foreign exchange rates, the total outstanding balance of cash and cash equivalents as of December&nbsp;31, 2021 was 1 trillion 822.6&nbsp;billion yen. Cash and cash equivalents of all segments excluding the Financial Services segment was 1 trillion
103.3&nbsp;billion yen as of December&nbsp;31, 2021, a decrease of 186.5&nbsp;billion yen compared with the balance as of March&nbsp;31, 2021, and a decrease of 222.0&nbsp;billion yen compared with the balance as of December&nbsp;31, 2020. Within
the Financial Services segment, the outstanding balance of cash and cash equivalents was 719.3&nbsp;billion yen as of December&nbsp;31, 2021, an increase of 222.1&nbsp;billion yen compared with the balance as of March&nbsp;31, 2021, and an increase
of 166.5&nbsp;billion yen compared with the balance as of December&nbsp;31, 2020. </p>
 <p style="margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt ; font-size:8pt">&nbsp;</p> <p style="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:9pt; font-family:Times New Roman" align="center">-14- </p>

</div></center>


<p style="margin-top:1em; margin-bottom:0em; page-break-before:always">
</p><hr size="3" style="COLOR:#999999" width="100%" align="CENTER">
<h5 align="left"><a href="https://www.sec.gov/Archives/edgar/data/313838/000119312522030320/d270438d6k.htm#toc">Table of Contents</a></h5>


<center><div style="width:8.5in" align="left">
 <p style="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:5%; font-size:10.5pt; font-family:Times New Roman" align="justify"><sup style="font-size:85%; vertical-align:top">*</sup>Sony’s
disclosure includes information regarding cash flow for all segments excluding the Financial Services segment. This information is derived from the following condensed statement of cash flows. The condensed statement of cash flows, which includes
the above-mentioned cash flow information, is not prepared in accordance with IFRS, which Sony uses to prepare its condensed consolidated financial statements. However, because the Financial Services segment is different in nature from Sony’s
other segments, Sony believes that a comparative presentation may be useful in understanding and analyzing Sony’s condensed consolidated financial statements. Transactions between the Financial Services segment and Sony without the Financial
Services segment, including noncontrolling interests, are included in those respective presentations, but are eliminated in the consolidated figures shown below. </p>
<p style="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10.5pt; font-family:Times New Roman">Condensed Statements of Cash Flows </p> <p style="font-size:12pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt">&nbsp;</p>

 <p style="margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt ; font-size:8pt">&nbsp;</p> <p style="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:9pt; font-family:Times New Roman" align="center">-16- </p>
