</tbody></table> <p style="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:5%; font-size:10.5pt; font-family:Times New Roman" align="justify">Transfers of debt securities from Level&nbsp;2 into Level&nbsp;1 were 900&nbsp;million yen
and 3,721&nbsp;million yen for the fiscal year ended March&nbsp;31, 2021 and for the nine months ended December&nbsp;31, 2021, respectively, as quoted prices in active markets for certain debt securities became available. Transfers of debt
securities from Level&nbsp;1 into Level&nbsp;2 were 904&nbsp;million yen for the fiscal year ended March&nbsp;31, 2021 as quoted prices in active markets for certain debt securities were not available. There were no transfers of debt securities from
Level&nbsp;1 into Level&nbsp;2 for the nine months ended December&nbsp;31, 2021. </p> <p style="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:5%; font-size:10.5pt; font-family:Times New Roman" align="justify">Transfers of equity securities from
Level&nbsp;2 into Level&nbsp;1 were 12,139&nbsp;million yen for the nine months ended December&nbsp;31, 2021 as quoted prices in active markets for certain equity securities became available. There were no transfers of equity securities from
Level&nbsp;2 into Level&nbsp;1 for the fiscal year ended March&nbsp;31, 2021. </p>
 <p style="margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt ; font-size:8pt">&nbsp;</p> <p style="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:9pt; font-family:Times New Roman" align="center">-54- </p>

</div></center>


<p style="margin-top:1em; margin-bottom:0em; page-break-before:always">
</p><hr size="3" style="COLOR:#999999" width="100%" align="CENTER">
<h5 align="left"><a href="https://www.sec.gov/Archives/edgar/data/313838/000119312522030320/d270438d6k.htm#toc">Table of Contents</a></h5>


<center><div style="width:8.5in" align="left">
 <p style="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:5%; font-size:10.5pt; font-family:Times New Roman" align="justify">Shares of Spotify Technology S.A. (“Spotify”) held by Sony are
classified as equity securities required to be measured at fair value through profit or loss. The <font style="white-space:nowrap">pre-tax</font> revaluation gains (losses) of the Spotify shares owned by Sony recognized in net income are included in
financial income (expenses) in the condensed consolidated statements of income, net of costs to be paid to Sony’s artists and distributed labels. </p>
<p style="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10.5pt; font-family:Times New Roman" align="justify">The valuation techniques used to measure the fair value of assets and liabilities classified as Level&nbsp;3, significant unobservable
inputs, and their range are as follows: </p> <p style="font-size:12pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt">&nbsp;</p>
<table cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" width="100%" border="0" style="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; font-family:Times New Roman; font-size:9pt" align="center">

<td valign="bottom">&nbsp;&nbsp;</td>
<td valign="bottom">&nbsp;</td>
<td valign="bottom" align="center"><font style="white-space:nowrap">110bp-150bp</font></td>
<td nowrap="" valign="bottom">&nbsp;</td>
<td valign="bottom">&nbsp;&nbsp;</td>
<td valign="bottom">&nbsp;</td>
<td valign="bottom" align="center"><font style="white-space:nowrap">100bp-150bp</font></td>
<td nowrap="" valign="bottom">&nbsp;</td>
<td valign="bottom">&nbsp;&nbsp;</td>
<td valign="bottom">&nbsp;</td>
<td valign="bottom" align="center">80bp-120bp</td>
<td nowrap="" valign="bottom">&nbsp;</td></tr>
</tbody></table> <p style="margin-top:10pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10.5pt; font-family:Times New Roman">* bp = basis point </p>
<p style="margin-top:10pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:5%; font-size:10.5pt; font-family:Times New Roman" align="justify">The decrease (increase) in fair value is the result of higher (lower) credit spreads. </p>
<p style="margin-top:10pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:5%; font-size:10.5pt; font-family:Times New Roman" align="justify">For the above assets classified as Level&nbsp;3, the fair value would not change significantly, even if one or more of the
significant unobservable inputs are changed to reflect reasonably possible alternative assumptions. </p> <p style="margin-top:10pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10.5pt; font-family:Times New Roman" align="justify">The changes in fair value of
Level&nbsp;3 assets and liabilities for the nine months ended December&nbsp;31, 2020 and 2021 are as follows: </p> <p style="font-size:10pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt">&nbsp;</p>
<table cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" width="100%" border="0" style="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; font-family:Times New Roman; font-size:9pt" align="center">

</tbody></table> <p style="font-size:6pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt">&nbsp;</p>
<table style="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; font-family:Times New Roman; font-size:10.5pt" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" width="100%">
<tbody><tr style="page-break-inside:avoid">
<td width="3%" valign="top" align="left">*1</td>
<td align="left" valign="top"> <p style=" margin-top:0pt ; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10.5pt; font-family:Times New Roman; " align="justify">For liability items, gains are presented as negative and losses are presented as positive.
</p></td></tr></tbody></table>
<table style="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; font-family:Times New Roman; font-size:10.5pt" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" width="100%">
<tbody><tr style="page-break-inside:avoid">
<td width="3%" valign="top" align="left">*2</td>
<td align="left" valign="top"> <p style=" margin-top:0pt ; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10.5pt; font-family:Times New Roman; " align="justify">Gains (losses) recognized in net income are included in financial services revenue, financial income and
financial expenses in the condensed consolidated statements of income. </p></td></tr></tbody></table>
<table style="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; font-family:Times New Roman; font-size:10.5pt" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" width="100%">
<tbody><tr style="page-break-inside:avoid">
<td width="3%" valign="top" align="left">*3</td>
<td align="left" valign="top"> <p style=" margin-top:0pt ; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10.5pt; font-family:Times New Roman; " align="justify">Gains (losses) recognized in other comprehensive income are included in changes in equity instruments
measured at fair value through other comprehensive income, changes in debt instruments measured at fair value through other comprehensive income and exchange differences on translating foreign operations in the condensed consolidated statements of
comprehensive income. </p></td></tr></tbody></table>
<table style="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; font-family:Times New Roman; font-size:10.5pt" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" width="100%">
<tbody><tr style="page-break-inside:avoid">
<td width="3%" valign="top" align="left">*4</td>
<td align="left" valign="top"> <p style=" margin-top:0pt ; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10.5pt; font-family:Times New Roman; " align="justify">Certain debt securities and equity securities were transferred into Level&nbsp;3 because differences
between the fair value determined by indicative quotes from dealers and the fair value determined by internally developed prices became significant and the observability of the inputs used decreased. </p></td></tr></tbody></table>
<table style="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; font-family:Times New Roman; font-size:10.5pt" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" width="100%">
<tbody><tr style="page-break-inside:avoid">
<td width="3%" valign="top" align="left">*5</td>
<td align="left" valign="top"> <p style=" margin-top:0pt ; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10.5pt; font-family:Times New Roman; " align="justify">Certain equity securities were transferred out of Level&nbsp;3 because observable market data became
available. </p></td></tr></tbody></table>
<table style="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; font-family:Times New Roman; font-size:10.5pt" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" width="100%">
<tbody><tr style="page-break-inside:avoid">
<td width="3%" valign="top" align="left">*6</td>
<td align="left" valign="top"> <p style=" margin-top:0pt ; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10.5pt; font-family:Times New Roman; " align="justify">The increase in equity securities designated to be measured at fair value through other comprehensive
income is mainly due to a change in the scope of consolidation. </p></td></tr></tbody></table>
 <p style="margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt ; font-size:8pt">&nbsp;</p> <p style="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:9pt; font-family:Times New Roman" align="center">-56- </p>

</div></center>

</tbody></table> <p style="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:4%; font-size:10.5pt; font-family:Times New Roman" align="justify">The table above does not include financial instruments measured at amortized cost whose
carrying amounts approximate their fair values mainly due to their short-term nature. </p> <p style="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:4%; font-size:10.5pt; font-family:Times New Roman" align="justify">The fair values of long-term
debt, including the current portion classified as Level&nbsp;2, were estimated mainly based on discounted future cash flows using Sony’s current rates for similar liabilities. </p>
<p style="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:4%; font-size:10.5pt; font-family:Times New Roman" align="justify">Financial instruments classified as Level&nbsp;3 mainly include housing loans in the banking business, securitized products
and certain bonds issued by Sony. In determining the fair value of such financial instruments, Sony uses the present value of expected cash flows based on <font style="white-space:nowrap">risk-free</font> interest rate yield curves with certain
credit risk. Transfers of housing loans in the banking business into Level&nbsp;3 occurred primarily due to increases in the significance of unobservable inputs during the fiscal year ended March&nbsp;31, 2021. </p>
 <p style="margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt ; font-size:8pt">&nbsp;</p> <p style="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:9pt; font-family:Times New Roman" align="center">-59- </p>

</div></center>


<p style="margin-top:1em; margin-bottom:0em; page-break-before:always">
</p><hr size="3" style="COLOR:#999999" width="100%" align="CENTER">
<h5 align="left"><a href="https://www.sec.gov/Archives/edgar/data/313838/000119312522030320/d270438d6k.htm#toc">Table of Contents</a></h5>


<center><div style="width:8.5in" align="left">

<table style="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; font-family:Times New Roman; font-size:10.5pt" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" width="100%">
<tbody><tr style="page-break-inside:avoid">
<td width="4%" valign="top" align="left"><b><i><a name="tx270438_20"></a></i></b><b>5.</b><b><i></i></b></td>
<td align="left" valign="top"> <p style=" margin-top:0pt ; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10.5pt; font-family:Times New Roman; " align="justify"><b><i>Insurance-related accounts measured at fair value </i></b></p></td></tr></tbody></table>
<p style="margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:4%; font-size:10.5pt; font-family:Times New Roman" align="justify">The fair value of future insurance policy benefits and policyholders’ account in the life insurance business measured at
fair value as of April&nbsp;1, 2020, March&nbsp;31, 2021 and December&nbsp;31, 2021 is as follows. These are classified within Level&nbsp;3 of the fair value hierarchy since Sony primarily uses unobservable inputs in its valuation. </p>
<p style="font-size:12pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt">&nbsp;</p>
<table cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" width="100%" border="0" style="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; font-family:Times New Roman; font-size:8pt" align="center">


<tbody><tr>

<td width="94%"></td>

<td valign="bottom" width="1%"></td>
<td></td>
<td></td>
<td></td>

<td valign="bottom" width="1%"></td>
<td></td>
<td></td>
<td></td>

<td valign="bottom" width="1%"></td>
<td></td>
<td></td>
<td></td></tr>
<tr style="page-break-inside:avoid ; font-family:Times New Roman; font-size:8pt">
<td valign="bottom">&nbsp;</td>
<td valign="bottom">&nbsp;&nbsp;</td>
<td valign="bottom" colspan="10" align="center" style="border-bottom:1.00pt solid #000000"><b>Yen&nbsp;in&nbsp;millions</b></td>
<td valign="bottom">&nbsp;</td></tr>
<tr style="page-break-inside:avoid ; font-family:Times New Roman; font-size:8pt">

<td align="left" valign="top"> <p style=" margin-top:0pt ; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10.5pt; font-family:Times New Roman; " align="justify">= basis point </p></td></tr></tbody></table>
<p style="margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:4%; font-size:10.5pt; font-family:Times New Roman" align="justify">The decrease (increase) in fair value is the result of higher (lower) credit spreads, mortality rates or lapse rates. The
fair value of the future insurance policy benefits and policyholders’ account in the life insurance business measured at fair value would not change significantly, even if one or more of the significant unobservable inputs are changed to
reflect reasonably possible alternative assumptions. </p>
 <p style="margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt ; font-size:8pt">&nbsp;</p> <p style="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:9pt; font-family:Times New Roman" align="center">-60- </p>

<h5 align="left"><a href="https://www.sec.gov/Archives/edgar/data/313838/000119312522030320/d270438d6k.htm#toc">Table of Contents</a></h5>


<center><div style="width:8.5in" align="left">

<table style="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; font-family:Times New Roman; font-size:10.5pt" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" width="100%">
<tbody><tr style="page-break-inside:avoid">
<td width="4%" valign="top" align="left"><b><i><a name="tx270438_21"></a></i></b><b>6.</b><b><i></i></b></td>
<td align="left" valign="top"> <p style=" margin-top:0pt ; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10.5pt; font-family:Times New Roman; " align="justify"><b><i>Stockholders’ equity </i></b></p></td></tr></tbody></table>
<p style="margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10.5pt; font-family:Times New Roman"><b><i>(1) Supplemental comprehensive income information </i></b></p>
<p style="margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:4%; font-size:10.5pt; font-family:Times New Roman" align="justify">Changes in accumulated other comprehensive income, net of tax, by component for the nine months ended December&nbsp;31, 2020
and 2021 are as follows: </p> <p style="font-size:12pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt">&nbsp;</p>
<table cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" width="100%" border="0" style="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; font-family:Times New Roman; font-size:9pt" align="center">


<tbody><tr>

 <p style="margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt ; font-size:8pt">&nbsp;</p> <p style="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:9pt; font-family:Times New Roman" align="center">-62- </p>

<p style="margin-top:1em; margin-bottom:0em; page-break-before:always">
</p><hr size="3" style="COLOR:#999999" width="100%" align="CENTER">
<h5 align="left"><a href="https://www.sec.gov/Archives/edgar/data/313838/000119312522030320/d270438d6k.htm#toc">Table of Contents</a></h5>


<center><div style="width:8.5in" align="left">
 <p style="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10.5pt; font-family:Times New Roman"><b><i>(2) Transaction with noncontrolling interests shareholders </i></b></p>
<p style="margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:4%; font-size:10.5pt; font-family:Times New Roman" align="justify">In the three months ended September&nbsp;30, 2020, Sony Group Corporation acquired all the common shares and the related
stock acquisition rights not held by Sony Group Corporation of Sony Financial Group Inc. (“SFGI”), a consolidated subsidiary of Sony Group Corporation, and SFGI became a wholly-owned subsidiary of Sony Group Corporation. Consideration for
this acquisition was 396,698&nbsp;million yen. The net difference between the consideration, the decrease in the carrying amount of the noncontrolling interests of 1,046,380&nbsp;million yen and the increase in accumulated other comprehensive income
of 457,072&nbsp;million yen was recognized as an increase to additional <font style="white-space:nowrap">paid-in</font> capital of 192,610&nbsp;million yen. On October&nbsp;1, 2021, SFGI changed its company name from Sony Financial Holdings Inc.
(“SFH”). </p> <p style="font-size:18pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt">&nbsp;</p>
<table style="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; font-family:Times New Roman; font-size:10.5pt" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" width="100%">
<tbody><tr style="page-break-inside:avoid">
<td width="4%" valign="top" align="left"><b><i><a name="tx270438_22"></a></i></b><b>7.</b><b><i></i></b></td>
<td align="left" valign="top"> <p style=" margin-top:0pt ; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10.5pt; font-family:Times New Roman; " align="justify"><b><i>Revenue </i></b></p></td></tr></tbody></table>
<p style="margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:4%; font-size:10.5pt; font-family:Times New Roman" align="justify">For the breakdown of sales and financial services revenue by segments, product categories and geographies, refer to Note 13.
</p> <p style="font-size:18pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt">&nbsp;</p>
<table style="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; font-family:Times New Roman; font-size:10.5pt" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" width="100%">
<tbody><tr style="page-break-inside:avoid">
<td width="4%" valign="top" align="left"><b><i><a name="tx270438_23"></a></i></b><b>8.</b><b><i></i></b></td>
<td align="left" valign="top"> <p style=" margin-top:0pt ; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10.5pt; font-family:Times New Roman; " align="justify"><b><i>Reversal of a previous write-down of the deferred tax assets of the consolidated tax filing group in
Japan </i></b></p></td></tr></tbody></table> <p style="margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:4%; font-size:10.5pt; font-family:Times New Roman" align="justify">Sony recognizes deferred tax assets, which include temporary differences, net operating
losses and tax credits, to the extent that it is probable that taxable profit will be available against which the assets can be utilized. The ultimate realization of deferred tax assets is dependent upon the generation of future taxable income in
the relevant tax jurisdiction. Despite the spread of <font style="white-space:nowrap">COVID-19,</font> as a result of the acquisition of SFGI in the three months ended September&nbsp;30, 2020, the taxable income of Sony Group Corporation and its
national tax filing group has increased and is expected to be stable going forward. Based on an assessment of the available evidence, in particular recent profit history and forecasted profitability, in the three months ended September&nbsp;30,
2020, Sony reversed a previous write-down of a significant portion of the deferred tax assets of the consolidated tax filing group in Japan, primarily for temporary differences and certain net operating losses. As a result, Sony recorded a tax
benefit of 214,346&nbsp;million yen in the three months ended September&nbsp;30, 2020.<b> </b>On October&nbsp;1, 2021, SFGI changed its company name from SFH. </p>
 <p style="margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt ; font-size:8pt">&nbsp;</p> <p style="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:9pt; font-family:Times New Roman" align="center">-63- </p>

</div></center>


<p style="margin-top:1em; margin-bottom:0em; page-break-before:always">
</p><hr size="3" style="COLOR:#999999" width="100%" align="CENTER">
<h5 align="left"><a href="https://www.sec.gov/Archives/edgar/data/313838/000119312522030320/d270438d6k.htm#toc">Table of Contents</a></h5>


<center><div style="width:8.5in" align="left">

</tbody></table> <p style="margin-top:10pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:4%; font-size:10.5pt; font-family:Times New Roman" align="justify">Potential shares of common stock which were excluded from the computation of diluted EPS for
the three months ended December&nbsp;31, 2020 and 2021 were 4,515&nbsp;thousand shares and 4,876&nbsp;thousand shares, respectively. The potential shares related to stock acquisition rights were excluded as anti-dilutive for the three months ended
December&nbsp;31, 2020 and 2021, when the exercise prices for those shares were in excess of the average market value of Sony Group Corporation’s common stock for those periods. </p>
 <p style="margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt ; font-size:8pt">&nbsp;</p> <p style="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:9pt; font-family:Times New Roman" align="center">-64- </p>

</div></center>


<p style="margin-top:1em; margin-bottom:0em; page-break-before:always">
</p><hr size="3" style="COLOR:#999999" width="100%" align="CENTER">
<h5 align="left"><a href="https://www.sec.gov/Archives/edgar/data/313838/000119312522030320/d270438d6k.htm#toc">Table of Contents</a></h5>


<center><div style="width:8.5in" align="left">

<table style="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; font-family:Times New Roman; font-size:10.5pt" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" width="100%">
<tbody><tr style="page-break-inside:avoid">
<td width="4%" valign="top" align="left"><b><i><a name="tx270438_25"></a></i></b><b>10.</b><b><i></i></b></td>
<td align="left" valign="top"> <p style=" margin-top:0pt ; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10.5pt; font-family:Times New Roman; " align="justify"><b><i>Ellation Holdings, Inc. acquisition </i></b></p></td></tr></tbody></table>
<p style="margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:4%; font-size:10.5pt; font-family:Times New Roman" align="justify">On August&nbsp;9, 2021, Sony Pictures Entertainment Inc. (“SPE”), a wholly-owned subsidiary of Sony, through
Funimation Global Group, LLC (“Funimation”), acquired 100% of the equity interest in Ellation Holdings, Inc. (“Ellation”), a subsidiary of AT&amp;T Inc., which operates the anime business “Crunchyroll”. Funimation is a
joint venture between SPE and Aniplex Inc., a subsidiary of Sony Music Entertainment (Japan) Inc. The consideration for the acquisition of 135,575&nbsp;million yen (1,234&nbsp;million U.S. dollars) was paid in cash. As a result of the acquisition,
Ellation has become a wholly-owned subsidiary of Sony. </p> <p style="margin-top:10pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:4%; font-size:10.5pt; font-family:Times New Roman" align="justify">Crunchyroll is a <font style="white-space:nowrap"><font style="white-space:nowrap">direct-to-consumer</font></font> service, connecting anime and manga fans across more than 200 countries and territories. Crunchyroll provides services including subscription <font style="white-space:nowrap"><font style="white-space:nowrap">video-on-demand,</font></font> advertising-based <font style="white-space:nowrap"><font style="white-space:nowrap">video-on-demand,</font></font> mobile games, manga, events, merchandise and distribution. The acquisition
brings together two animation distribution brands, Funimation and Crunchyroll, allowing Sony to expand <font style="white-space:nowrap">fan-centric</font> offerings. </p>
<p style="margin-top:10pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:4%; font-size:10.5pt; font-family:Times New Roman" align="justify">As a result of the acquisition, Sony consolidated Ellation by using the acquisition method of accounting and recorded the
fair value of the identifiable assets acquired, liabilities assumed and residual goodwill of Ellation. The following table summarizes the fair values assigned to the assets and liabilities of Ellation that were recorded in the Pictures segment. The
purchase price allocation as of the date of the acquisition is preliminary and is subject to change as of December&nbsp;31, 2021. The primary areas of the purchase price allocation that are not yet finalized are related to deferred tax liabilities,
content assets, other intangible assets and goodwill. </p> <p style="font-size:10pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt">&nbsp;</p>
<table cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" width="88%" border="0" style="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; font-family:Times New Roman; font-size:9pt" align="center">


<tbody><tr>

<td width="85%"></td>

<td valign="bottom" width="10%"></td>
<td></td>
<td></td>
<td></td></tr>
<tr style="page-break-inside:avoid ; font-family:Times New Roman; font-size:9pt">
<td valign="bottom">&nbsp;</td>
<td valign="bottom">&nbsp;&nbsp;</td>
<td valign="bottom" colspan="2" align="center" style="border-bottom:1.00px solid #000000"><b>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Yen&nbsp;in&nbsp;millions&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</b></td>
<td valign="bottom">&nbsp;</td></tr>


<tr bgcolor="#cceeff" style="page-break-inside:avoid ; font-family:Times New Roman; font-size:9pt">
<td valign="top"> <p style=" margin-top:0pt ; margin-bottom:0pt; margin-left:0.56em; font-size:9pt; font-family:Times New Roman">Cash and cash equivalents</p></td>
<td valign="bottom">&nbsp;&nbsp;</td>
<td valign="bottom">&nbsp;</td>
<td valign="bottom" align="right">8,379</td>
<td nowrap="" valign="bottom">&nbsp;</td></tr>
<tr style="page-break-inside:avoid ; font-family:Times New Roman; font-size:9pt">
<td valign="top"> <p style=" margin-top:0pt ; margin-bottom:0pt; margin-left:0.56em; font-size:9pt; font-family:Times New Roman">Trade and other receivables, and contract assets</p></td>
<td valign="bottom">&nbsp;&nbsp;</td>
<td valign="bottom">&nbsp;</td>
<td valign="bottom" align="right">3,714</td>
<td nowrap="" valign="bottom">&nbsp;</td></tr>
<tr bgcolor="#cceeff" style="page-break-inside:avoid ; font-family:Times New Roman; font-size:9pt">
<td valign="top"> <p style=" margin-top:0pt ; margin-bottom:0pt; margin-left:0.56em; font-size:9pt; font-family:Times New Roman">Inventories</p></td>
<td valign="bottom">&nbsp;&nbsp;</td>
<td valign="bottom">&nbsp;</td>
<td valign="bottom" align="right">3,295</td>
<td nowrap="" valign="bottom">&nbsp;</td></tr>
<tr style="page-break-inside:avoid ; font-family:Times New Roman; font-size:9pt">
<td valign="top"> <p style=" margin-top:0pt ; margin-bottom:0pt; margin-left:0.56em; font-size:9pt; font-family:Times New Roman"><font style="white-space:nowrap"><font style="white-space:nowrap">Right-of-use</font></font> assets</p></td>
<td valign="bottom">&nbsp;&nbsp;</td>
<td valign="bottom">&nbsp;</td>
<td valign="bottom" align="right">4,962</td>
<td nowrap="" valign="bottom">&nbsp;</td></tr>
<tr bgcolor="#cceeff" style="page-break-inside:avoid ; font-family:Times New Roman; font-size:9pt">

</tbody></table> <p style="margin-top:10pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:4%; font-size:10.5pt; font-family:Times New Roman" align="justify">Content assets and other intangible assets mainly consist of license agreements and customer
relationships. Goodwill represents unidentifiable intangible assets, such as future growth from new revenue streams and synergies with existing Sony assets and businesses, and is calculated as the excess of the purchase price over the estimated fair
value of the tangible and intangible assets acquired and is not deductible for tax purposes. The goodwill recorded in connection with the acquisition is included in the Pictures segment. </p>
<p style="margin-top:10pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:4%; font-size:10.5pt; font-family:Times New Roman" align="justify">Revenue and net income attributable to Ellation since the date of acquisition included in Sony’s consolidated
statements of income and pro forma results of operations have not been presented because the effect of the acquisition was not material. </p>
 <p style="margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt ; font-size:8pt">&nbsp;</p> <p style="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:9pt; font-family:Times New Roman" align="center">-65- </p>

</div></center>


<p style="margin-top:1em; margin-bottom:0em; page-break-before:always">
</p><hr size="3" style="COLOR:#999999" width="100%" align="CENTER">
<h5 align="left"><a href="https://www.sec.gov/Archives/edgar/data/313838/000119312522030320/d270438d6k.htm#toc">Table of Contents</a></h5>


<center><div style="width:8.5in" align="left">

<table style="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; font-family:Times New Roman; font-size:10.5pt" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" width="100%">
<tbody><tr style="page-break-inside:avoid">
<td width="4%" valign="top" align="left"><b><i><a name="tx270438_26"></a></i></b><b>11.</b><b><i></i></b></td>
<td align="left" valign="top"> <p style=" margin-top:0pt ; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10.5pt; font-family:Times New Roman; " align="justify"><b><i>Transfer of certain operations of Game Show Network, LLC </i></b></p></td></tr></tbody></table>
<p style="margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:4%; font-size:10.5pt; font-family:Times New Roman" align="justify">On December&nbsp;6, 2021, Sony completed the transfer of GSN Games, a division of Game Show Network, LLC, a wholly-owned
subsidiary in the Pictures segment, to Scopely, Inc. (“Scopely”). The consideration for the transaction was 114,724&nbsp;million yen (1,008&nbsp;million U.S. dollars), of which Sony received 57,801&nbsp;million yen (508&nbsp;million U.S.
dollars) in cash and 56,923&nbsp;million yen (500&nbsp;million U.S. dollars) in preferred stock of Scopely. The consideration is subject to customary working capital and other adjustments. </p>
<p style="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:4%; font-size:10.5pt; font-family:Times New Roman" align="justify">This preferred stock is measured at fair value as an equity instrument and subsequent changes in the fair value will be
recognized in other comprehensive income. As a result of the completion of this transfer, Sony recognized a gain of 70,202&nbsp;million yen (617&nbsp;million U.S. dollars) within other operating (income) expense, net in the consolidated statements
of income for the three and nine months ended December&nbsp;31, 2021. </p>
 <p style="margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt ; font-size:8pt">&nbsp;</p> <p style="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:9pt; font-family:Times New Roman" align="center">-66- </p>

</div></center>


<p style="margin-top:1em; margin-bottom:0em; page-break-before:always">
</p><hr size="3" style="COLOR:#999999" width="100%" align="CENTER">
<h5 align="left"><a href="https://www.sec.gov/Archives/edgar/data/313838/000119312522030320/d270438d6k.htm#toc">Table of Contents</a></h5>


<center><div style="width:8.5in" align="left">

<table style="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; font-family:Times New Roman; font-size:10.5pt" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" width="100%">
<tbody><tr style="page-break-inside:avoid">
<td width="4%" valign="top" align="left"><b><i><a name="tx270438_27"></a></i></b><b>12.</b><b><i></i></b></td>
<td align="left" valign="top"> <p style=" margin-top:0pt ; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10.5pt; font-family:Times New Roman; " align="justify"><b><i>Purchase commitments, contingent liabilities and other </i></b></p></td></tr></tbody></table>
<p style="margin-top:10pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10.5pt; font-family:Times New Roman"><b><i>(1) Loan commitments </i></b></p>
<p style="margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:4%; font-size:10.5pt; font-family:Times New Roman" align="justify">Subsidiaries in the Financial Services segment have lines of credit in accordance with loan agreements with their customers.
As of April&nbsp;1, 2020, March&nbsp;31, 2021 and December 31, 2021, the total unused portion of the lines of credit extended under these contracts was 34,306&nbsp;million yen, 37,322&nbsp;million yen, and 36,125&nbsp;million yen, respectively. </p>
<p style="margin-top:10pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10.5pt; font-family:Times New Roman"><b><i>(2) Purchase commitments </i></b></p>
<p style="margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:4%; font-size:10.5pt; font-family:Times New Roman" align="justify">Purchase commitments as of April&nbsp;1, 2020, March&nbsp;31, 2021 and December&nbsp;31, 2021 amounted to
680,739&nbsp;million yen, 629,474&nbsp;million yen and 989,263&nbsp;million yen, respectively. The amount of these purchase commitments covers the purchase consideration for property, plant and equipment, intangible assets, other goods and other
services. The major components of these purchase commitments are as follows: </p> <p style="margin-top:10pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:4%; font-size:10.5pt; font-family:Times New Roman" align="justify">Certain subsidiaries in the Pictures
segment have entered into agreements with creative talent for the development and production of motion pictures and television programming as well as agreements with third parties to acquire completed motion pictures, or certain rights therein, and
to acquire the rights to broadcast certain live action sporting events. These agreements cover various periods mainly within three years from the end of each period. As of April&nbsp;1, 2020, March&nbsp;31, 2021 and December&nbsp;31, 2021, these
subsidiaries were committed to make payments under such contracts of 126,917&nbsp;million yen, 105,921&nbsp;million yen and 95,021&nbsp;million yen, respectively. </p>
<p style="margin-top:10pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:4%; font-size:10.5pt; font-family:Times New Roman" align="justify">Certain subsidiaries in the Music segment have entered into contracts with recording artists, songwriters and companies for
the future production, distribution and/or licensing of music products. These contracts cover various periods mainly within five years from the end of each period. As of April&nbsp;1, 2020, March&nbsp;31, 2021 and December&nbsp;31, 2021, these
subsidiaries were committed to make payments of 128,678&nbsp;million yen, 149,021&nbsp;million yen and 158,994&nbsp;million yen, respectively under such contracts. </p>
<p style="margin-top:10pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:4%; font-size:10.5pt; font-family:Times New Roman" align="justify">Certain subsidiaries in the Game&nbsp;&amp; Network Services (“G&amp;NS”) segment have entered into long-term
contracts for the development, distribution and publishing of game software. These contracts cover various periods mainly within seven years from the end of each period. As of April&nbsp;1, 2020, March&nbsp;31, 2021 and December&nbsp;31, 2021, these
subsidiaries were committed to make payments of 29,243&nbsp;million yen, 32,959&nbsp;million yen and 34,946&nbsp;million yen, respectively under such contracts. </p>
<p style="margin-top:10pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:4%; font-size:10.5pt; font-family:Times New Roman" align="justify">In addition to the above, Sony has entered into purchase contracts for property, plant and equipment and intangible assets.
As of April&nbsp;1, 2020, March&nbsp;31, 2021 and December&nbsp;31, 2021, Sony has committed to make payments of 199,145&nbsp;million yen, 135,297&nbsp;million yen and 234,365&nbsp;million yen, respectively under such contracts. </p>
<p style="margin-top:10pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:4%; font-size:10.5pt; font-family:Times New Roman" align="justify">Sony has entered into purchase contracts for materials. As of April&nbsp;1, 2020, March&nbsp;31, 2021 and December&nbsp;31,
2021, Sony has committed to make payments of 115,670&nbsp;million yen, 96,589&nbsp;million yen and 273,884&nbsp;million yen, respectively under such contracts. </p>
<p style="margin-top:10pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10.5pt; font-family:Times New Roman"><b><i>(3) Litigation </i></b></p>
<p style="margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:4%; font-size:10.5pt; font-family:Times New Roman" align="justify">Sony Group Corporation and certain of its subsidiaries are defendants or otherwise involved in pending legal and regulatory
proceedings. However, based upon the information currently available, Sony believes that the outcome from such legal and regulatory proceedings would not have a material impact on Sony’s results of operations and financial position. </p>
<p style="margin-top:10pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10.5pt; font-family:Times New Roman"><b><i>(4) Guarantees </i></b></p>
<p style="margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:4%; font-size:10.5pt; font-family:Times New Roman" align="justify">Sony has issued guarantees that contingently require payments to guaranteed parties if certain specified events or conditions
occur. The maximum potential amount of future payments under these guarantees as of April&nbsp;1, 2020, March&nbsp;31, 2021 and December&nbsp;31, 2021 amounted to 2,214&nbsp;million yen, 529&nbsp;million yen and 585&nbsp;million yen, respectively.
</p>
 <p style="margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt ; font-size:8pt">&nbsp;</p> <p style="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:9pt; font-family:Times New Roman" align="center">-67- </p>

</div></center>


<p style="margin-top:1em; margin-bottom:0em; page-break-before:always">
</p><hr size="3" style="COLOR:#999999" width="100%" align="CENTER">
<h5 align="left"><a href="https://www.sec.gov/Archives/edgar/data/313838/000119312522030320/d270438d6k.htm#toc">Table of Contents</a></h5>


<center><div style="width:8.5in" align="left">

<table style="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; font-family:Times New Roman; font-size:10.5pt" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" width="100%">
<tbody><tr style="page-break-inside:avoid">
<td width="4%" valign="top" align="left"><b><i><a name="tx270438_28"></a></i></b><b>13.</b><b><i></i></b></td>
<td align="left" valign="top"> <p style=" margin-top:0pt ; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10.5pt; font-family:Times New Roman; " align="justify"><b><i>Business segment information </i></b></p></td></tr></tbody></table>
<p style="margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:4%; font-size:10.5pt; font-family:Times New Roman" align="justify">The reportable segments presented below are the segments of Sony for which separate financial information is available and
for which operating profit or loss amounts are evaluated regularly by the chief operating decision maker (“CODM”) in deciding how to allocate resources and in assessing performance. The CODM does not evaluate segments using discrete asset
information. Sony’s CODM is its Chairman, President and Chief Executive Officer. </p> <p style="margin-top:10pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:4%; font-size:10.5pt; font-family:Times New Roman" align="justify">Due to organizational changes as
of April&nbsp;1, 2021, from the first quarter of the fiscal year ending March&nbsp;31, 2022, Sony transferred some of the businesses and functions previously included within All Other and Corporate and elimination to the EP&amp;S segment. In
connection with these organizational changes, sales and financial services revenue and operating income (loss) of each segment for the fiscal year ended March&nbsp;31, 2021 are presented to conform to the organizational structure for the fiscal year
ending March&nbsp;31, 2022. </p> <p style="margin-top:10pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:4%; font-size:10.5pt; font-family:Times New Roman" align="justify">The G&amp;NS segment includes network services businesses, the manufacture and sales of
home gaming products and the production and sales of software. The Music segment includes the Recorded Music, Music Publishing and Visual Media and Platform businesses. The Pictures segment includes the Motion Pictures, Television Productions and
Media Networks businesses. The EP&amp;S segment includes the Televisions business, the Audio and Video business, the Still and Video Cameras business, the smartphone business and internet-related service business. The I&amp;SS segment includes the
image sensors business. The Financial Services segment primarily represents individual life insurance and <font style="white-space:nowrap">non-life</font> insurance businesses in the Japanese market and the banking business in Japan. All Other
consists of various operating activities, including the disc manufacturing and recording media businesses. Sony’s products and services are generally unique to a single operating segment. </p>
 <p style="margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt ; font-size:8pt">&nbsp;</p> <p style="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:9pt; font-family:Times New Roman" align="center">-68- </p>

</div></center>


<p style="margin-top:1em; margin-bottom:0em; page-break-before:always">
</p><hr size="3" style="COLOR:#999999" width="100%" align="CENTER">

<td nowrap="" valign="bottom">&nbsp;</td></tr>

</tbody></table> <p style="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:4%; font-size:10.5pt; font-family:Times New Roman" align="justify">G&amp;NS intersegment amounts primarily consist of transactions with the EP&amp;S segment.
EP&amp;S intersegment amounts primarily consist of transactions with the G&amp;NS segment. I&amp;SS intersegment amounts primarily consist of transactions with the G&amp;NS segment and the EP&amp;S segment. Corporate and elimination includes certain
brand and patent royalty income. </p>
 <p style="margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt ; font-size:8pt">&nbsp;</p> <p style="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:9pt; font-family:Times New Roman" align="center">-70- </p>

</div></center>


<p style="margin-top:1em; margin-bottom:0em; page-break-before:always">

</tbody></table> <p style="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:4%; font-size:10.5pt; font-family:Times New Roman" align="justify">Operating income (loss) is sales and financial services revenue less costs and expenses, and
includes the share of profit (loss) of investments accounted for using the equity method. </p>
 <p style="margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt ; font-size:8pt">&nbsp;</p> <p style="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:9pt; font-family:Times New Roman" align="center">-71- </p>

 <p style="margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt ; font-size:8pt">&nbsp;</p> <p style="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:9pt; font-family:Times New Roman" align="center">-72- </p>

</div></center>


<p style="margin-top:1em; margin-bottom:0em; page-break-before:always">
</p><hr size="3" style="COLOR:#999999" width="100%" align="CENTER">
<h5 align="left"><a href="https://www.sec.gov/Archives/edgar/data/313838/000119312522030320/d270438d6k.htm#toc">Table of Contents</a></h5>


<center><div style="width:8.5in" align="left">
 <p style="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10.5pt; font-family:Times New Roman" align="justify">Sales to customers by product category: </p>
<p style="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:4%; font-size:10.5pt; font-family:Times New Roman" align="justify">The following table is a breakdown of sales and financial services revenue to external customers by product category for
each segment. Sony management views each segment as a single operating segment. </p> <p style="font-size:12pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt">&nbsp;</p>

<td valign="bottom">&nbsp;</td>
<td valign="bottom" align="right">6,762,041</td>
<td nowrap="" valign="bottom">&nbsp;</td>
<td valign="bottom">&nbsp;</td>
<td valign="bottom">&nbsp;</td>
<td valign="bottom" align="right">7,657,527</td>
<td nowrap="" valign="bottom">&nbsp;</td></tr>
<tr style="font-size:1px; ">
<td valign="bottom"></td>
<td valign="bottom">&nbsp;&nbsp;</td>
<td valign="bottom"> <p style=" margin-top:0pt ; margin-bottom:0pt; border-top:1.00px solid #000000">&nbsp;</p></td>

<td>&nbsp;</td></tr>
</tbody></table>

<td valign="bottom">&nbsp;</td>
<td valign="bottom" align="right">3,941</td>
<td nowrap="" valign="bottom">&nbsp;</td></tr>
<tr style="font-size:1px; ">
<td valign="bottom"> <p style=" margin-top:0pt ; margin-bottom:0pt; border-top:1.00px solid #000000">&nbsp;</p></td>
<td valign="bottom">&nbsp;&nbsp;</td>
<td valign="bottom"> <p style=" margin-top:0pt ; margin-bottom:0pt; border-top:1.00px solid #000000">&nbsp;</p></td>
<td valign="bottom"> <p style=" margin-top:0pt ; margin-bottom:0pt; border-top:1.00px solid #000000">&nbsp;</p></td>
<td>&nbsp;</td>
<td valign="bottom">&nbsp;</td>
<td valign="bottom"> <p style=" margin-top:0pt ; margin-bottom:0pt; border-top:1.00px solid #000000">&nbsp;</p></td>
<td valign="bottom"> <p style=" margin-top:0pt ; margin-bottom:0pt; border-top:1.00px solid #000000">&nbsp;</p></td>
<td>&nbsp;</td></tr>
<tr style="page-break-inside:avoid ; font-family:Times New Roman; font-size:9pt">
<td valign="top"> <p style=" margin-top:0pt ; margin-bottom:0pt; margin-left:2.50em; text-indent:-1.00em; font-size:9pt; font-family:Times New Roman">Consolidated total</p></td>
<td valign="bottom">&nbsp;&nbsp;</td>
<td valign="bottom">&nbsp;</td>
<td valign="bottom" align="right">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;2,693,975</td>
<td nowrap="" valign="bottom">&nbsp;</td>
<td valign="bottom">&nbsp;</td>
<td valign="bottom">&nbsp;</td>
<td valign="bottom" align="right">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;3,031,319</td>
<td nowrap="" valign="bottom">&nbsp;</td></tr>
<tr style="font-size:1px; ">
<td valign="bottom"></td>
<td valign="bottom">&nbsp;&nbsp;</td>
<td valign="bottom"> <p style=" margin-top:0pt ; margin-bottom:0pt; border-top:1.00px solid #000000">&nbsp;</p></td>
<td valign="bottom"> <p style=" margin-top:0pt ; margin-bottom:0pt; border-top:1.00px solid #000000">&nbsp;</p></td>
<td>&nbsp;</td>
<td valign="bottom">&nbsp;</td>
<td valign="bottom"> <p style=" margin-top:0pt ; margin-bottom:0pt; border-top:1.00px solid #000000">&nbsp;</p></td>
<td valign="bottom"> <p style=" margin-top:0pt ; margin-bottom:0pt; border-top:1.00px solid #000000">&nbsp;</p></td>
<td>&nbsp;</td></tr>
</tbody></table> <p style="margin-top:10pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:4%; font-size:10.5pt; font-family:Times New Roman" align="justify">In the G&amp;NS segment, Digital Software and <font style="white-space:nowrap">Add-on</font>
Content includes distribution of software titles and <font style="white-space:nowrap">add-on</font> content through the network by Sony Interactive Entertainment; Network Services includes network services relating to game, video and music content;
Hardware and Others includes home gaming consoles, packaged software, peripheral devices and first-party software for third-party platforms. In the Music segment, Recorded Music – Streaming includes the distribution of digital recorded music by
streaming; Recorded Music – Others includes the distribution of recorded music by physical media and digital download as well as revenue derived from artists’ live performances; Music Publishing includes the management and licensing of the
words and music of songs; Visual Media and Platform includes the production and distribution of animation titles, including game applications based on the animation titles, and various service offerings for music and visual products. In the Pictures
segment, Motion Pictures includes the worldwide production, acquisition and distribution of live-action and animated motion pictures; Television Productions includes the production, acquisition and distribution of television programming; Media
Networks includes the operation of television and digital networks worldwide. In the EP&amp;S segment, Televisions includes LCD and OLED televisions; Audio and Video includes <font style="white-space:nowrap">Blu-ray</font> disc players and
recorders, home audio, headphones and memory-based portable audio devices; Still and Video Cameras includes interchangeable lens cameras, compact digital cameras, consumer video cameras and video cameras for broadcast; Mobile Communications includes
smartphones and an internet-related service business; Other includes display products such as projectors and medical equipment. </p>
 <p style="margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt ; font-size:8pt">&nbsp;</p> <p style="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:9pt; font-family:Times New Roman" align="center">-74- </p>

<tr style="page-break-inside:avoid ; font-family:Times New Roman; font-size:10.5pt">
<td valign="top"> <p style=" margin-top:0pt ; margin-bottom:0pt; margin-left:1.00em; text-indent:-1.00em; font-size:10.5pt; font-family:Times New Roman">(1) Europe:</p></td>

</tbody></table> <p style="margin-top:10pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:4%; font-size:10.5pt; font-family:Times New Roman" align="justify">There are no individually material countries with respect to sales and financial services
revenue included in Europe, Asia-Pacific and Other Areas. </p> <p style="margin-top:10pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:4%; font-size:10.5pt; font-family:Times New Roman" align="justify">Transfers between reportable business segments or geographic
areas are made at individually negotiated prices that are intended to reflect a market-based transfer price. </p> <p style="margin-top:10pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:5%; font-size:10.5pt; font-family:Times New Roman" align="justify">There were
no sales and financial services revenue with any single major external customer for the nine and three months ended December&nbsp;31, 2020 and 2021. </p>
 <p style="margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt ; font-size:8pt">&nbsp;</p> <p style="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:9pt; font-family:Times New Roman" align="center">-75- </p>

<p style="margin-top:1em; margin-bottom:0em; page-break-before:always">

<h5 align="left"><a href="https://www.sec.gov/Archives/edgar/data/313838/000119312522030320/d270438d6k.htm#toc">Table of Contents</a></h5>


<center><div style="width:8.5in" align="left">

<table style="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; font-family:Times New Roman; font-size:10.5pt" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" width="100%">
<tbody><tr style="page-break-inside:avoid">
<td width="5%" valign="top" align="left"><b><a name="tx270438_29"></a>14.</b><b><i></i></b></td>
<td align="left" valign="top"> <p style=" margin-top:0pt ; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10.5pt; font-family:Times New Roman; " align="justify"><b><i>First-time adoption </i></b></p></td></tr></tbody></table>
<p style="margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:5%; font-size:10.5pt; font-family:Times New Roman" align="justify">Sony has disclosed its condensed consolidated financial statements under IFRS from the first quarter of the fiscal year
ending March&nbsp;31, 2022. The latest consolidated financial statements under U.S. GAAP were prepared for the fiscal year ended March&nbsp;31, 2021, and the date of transition to IFRS was April&nbsp;1, 2020. </p>
<p style="margin-top:10pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10.5pt; font-family:Times New Roman"><b><i>(1) Exemption under IFRS 1 </i></b></p>
<p style="margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:5%; font-size:10.5pt; font-family:Times New Roman" align="justify">IFRS 1 requires that a company adopting IFRS for the first-time (“first-time adopters”) shall apply IFRS
retrospectively. However, IFRS 1 provides certain exemptions that allow first-time adopters to choose not to apply certain standards retrospectively. Sony has adopted the following exemptions: </p>
<p style="margin-top:10pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:5%; font-size:10.5pt; font-family:Times New Roman" align="justify"><u>Business combinations </u></p>
<p style="margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:5%; font-size:10.5pt; font-family:Times New Roman" align="justify">First-time adopters may choose not to apply IFRS 3 “Business Combinations” (“IFRS 3”) retrospectively to
business combinations that occurred before the date of transition to IFRS. Sony has applied this exemption and chosen not to apply IFRS 3 retrospectively to business combinations that occurred before the date of transition to IFRS. Therefore, the
carrying amounts of goodwill generated in business combinations that occurred prior to the date of transition to IFRS were based on the carrying amounts determined under U.S. GAAP at the date of transition to IFRS. </p>
<p style="margin-top:10pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:5%; font-size:10.5pt; font-family:Times New Roman" align="justify">Sony performed an impairment test on goodwill at the date of transition to IFRS regardless of whether there were any
indications that the goodwill may be impaired, refer to Note 3 I. Significant accounting policies (10). </p> <p style="margin-top:10pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:5%; font-size:10.5pt; font-family:Times New Roman" align="justify"><u>Exchange
differences on translating foreign operations </u></p> <p style="margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:5%; font-size:10.5pt; font-family:Times New Roman" align="justify">First-time adopters may choose to deem the cumulative exchange
differences on translating foreign operations as zero at the date of transition to IFRS. Sony has chosen to apply this exemption and deemed all cumulative exchange differences on translating foreign operations as zero at the date of transition to
IFRS. </p> <p style="margin-top:10pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:5%; font-size:10.5pt; font-family:Times New Roman" align="justify"><u>Designation of financial instruments recognized before the date of transition to IFRS </u></p>
<p style="margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:5%; font-size:10.5pt; font-family:Times New Roman" align="justify">First-time adopters may designate an investment in an equity instrument as an investment recognized at fair value through
other comprehensive income in accordance with IFRS 9 “Financial Instruments” based on the facts and circumstances that existed at the date of transition to IFRS. Sony has applied this exemption and designated some equity instruments at
fair value in other comprehensive income at the date of transition to IFRS. </p> <p style="margin-top:10pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:5%; font-size:10.5pt; font-family:Times New Roman" align="justify"><u>Recognition of ROU assets and lease
liabilities </u></p> <p style="margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:5%; font-size:10.5pt; font-family:Times New Roman" align="justify">When first-time adopters recognize ROU assets and lease liabilities as a lessee, they are permitted to
measure ROU assets and lease liabilities at the date of transition to IFRS. Sony measured all lease liabilities at the date of transition to IFRS at the present value of the remaining lease payments, discounted using Sony’s incremental
borrowing rate at the date of transition to IFRS. Sony recognized ROU assets equal to the amount of lease liabilities at the date of transition to IFRS. </p>
<p style="margin-top:10pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10.5pt; font-family:Times New Roman"><b><i>(2) Mandatory exception under IFRS 1 </i></b></p>
<p style="margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:5%; font-size:10.5pt; font-family:Times New Roman" align="justify">IFRS 1 prohibits the retrospective application of IFRS concerning “estimates”,
<font style="white-space:nowrap">“non-controlling</font> interests”, “classification and measurement of financial instruments” and other items. Sony applied these items prospectively from the date of transition to IFRS. </p>
<p style="margin-top:10pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10.5pt; font-family:Times New Roman"><b><i>(3) Reconciliation </i></b></p>
<p style="margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:5%; font-size:10.5pt; font-family:Times New Roman" align="justify">The reconciliations required to be disclosed in the first IFRS financial statements are described in the reconciliations as
below. “Reclassification” includes items that do not affect retained earnings and comprehensive income, while “Recognition and measurement differences” includes items that affect retained earnings and comprehensive income. </p>
 <p style="margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt ; font-size:8pt">&nbsp;</p> <p style="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:9pt; font-family:Times New Roman" align="center">-76- </p>

</div></center>


<p style="margin-top:1em; margin-bottom:0em; page-break-before:always">
</p><hr size="3" style="COLOR:#999999" width="100%" align="CENTER">

<td valign="bottom" style="BORDER-BOTTOM:1px solid #000000" align="right">1,942,420</td>

<td valign="bottom"><b>Total liabilities and equity</b></td></tr>
</tbody></table> <p style="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:9pt; font-family:Times New Roman">* “U.S. GAAP” represents the consolidated financial statements under U.S. GAAP for the year ended March&nbsp;31, 2020,
adjusted for the adoption of the Accounting Standards Updates issued by the Financial Accounting Standards Board effective as of April&nbsp;1, 2020. </p>

<p style="font-size:12pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt">&nbsp;</p>
<table cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" width="100%" border="0" style="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; font-family:Times New Roman; font-size:9pt" align="center">

<td width="22%"></td></tr>

<td nowrap="" valign="middle" style="BORDER-BOTTOM:1px solid #000000">)&nbsp;</td>

<td valign="middle" style="BORDER-BOTTOM:1px solid #000000">&nbsp;</td>
<td valign="middle" style="BORDER-BOTTOM:1px solid #000000" align="right">(12,519</td>
<td nowrap="" valign="middle" style="BORDER-BOTTOM:1px solid #000000">)&nbsp;</td>
<td valign="bottom">&nbsp;</td>
<td valign="bottom"></td>
<td valign="bottom">&nbsp;&nbsp;</td>
<td valign="middle">Noncontrolling interests</td></tr>
</tbody></table>
 <p style="margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt ; font-size:8pt">&nbsp;</p> <p style="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:9pt; font-family:Times New Roman" align="center">-84- </p>

</div></center>


<p style="margin-top:1em; margin-bottom:0em; page-break-before:always">

 <p style="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10.5pt; font-family:Times New Roman" align="justify"><u>Reconciliation of comprehensive income for three months ended December&nbsp;31, 2020
</u></p> <p style="font-size:12pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt">&nbsp;</p>
<table cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" width="100%" border="0" style="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; font-family:Times New Roman; font-size:9pt" align="center">


<tbody><tr>

<td width="29%"></td>

<td valign="bottom" width="1%"></td>

<td valign="bottom" width="1%"></td>
<td></td>

<td valign="bottom">&nbsp;&nbsp;</td>

 <p style="margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt ; font-size:8pt">&nbsp;</p> <p style="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:9pt; font-family:Times New Roman" align="center">-88- </p>

</div></center>


<p style="margin-top:1em; margin-bottom:0em; page-break-before:always">
</p><hr size="3" style="COLOR:#999999" width="100%" align="CENTER">
<h5 align="left"><a href="https://www.sec.gov/Archives/edgar/data/313838/000119312522030320/d270438d6k.htm#toc">Table of Contents</a></h5>


<center><div style="width:8.5in" align="left">
 <p style="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10.5pt; font-family:Times New Roman"><b><i>(4) Notes to reconciliation </i></b></p>
<p style="margin-top:18pt; margin-bottom:0pt; margin-left:2%; font-size:10.5pt; font-family:Times New Roman" align="justify"><u>Reclassifications </u></p> <p style="font-size:12pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt">&nbsp;</p>
<table style="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; font-family:Times New Roman; font-size:10.5pt" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" width="100%">
<tbody><tr style="page-break-inside:avoid">
<td width="1%">&nbsp;</td>
<td width="2%" valign="top" align="left">a.</td>
<td align="left" valign="top"> <p style=" margin-top:0pt ; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10.5pt; font-family:Times New Roman; " align="justify">“Marketable securities”, which were separately presented under U.S. GAAP, have been reclassified
into “Investments and advances in the Financial Services segment” as current assets under IFRS. Investments held for variable annuities and variable life insurance contracts in the life insurance business, which were included in
“Marketable securities” under U.S. GAAP, have been reclassified into “Investments and advances in the Financial Services segment” as current assets or <font style="white-space:nowrap">non-current</font> assets under IFRS, after
considering the <font style="white-space:nowrap">current/non-current</font> distinction based on the purpose of the investments related to the insurance liabilities in accordance with paragraph 66 of IAS 1 “Presentation of Financial
Statements” (“IAS 1”). </p></td></tr></tbody></table> <p style="font-size:2pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt">&nbsp;</p>
<table style="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; font-family:Times New Roman; font-size:10.5pt" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" width="100%">
<tbody><tr style="page-break-inside:avoid">
<td width="1%">&nbsp;</td>
<td width="2%" valign="top" align="left">b.</td>
<td align="left" valign="top"> <p style=" margin-top:0pt ; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10.5pt; font-family:Times New Roman; " align="justify">“Notes and accounts receivable, trade and contract assets” and “Allowance for credit
losses”, which were separately presented under U.S. GAAP, have been reclassified into “Trade and other receivables, and contract assets” under IFRS. </p></td></tr></tbody></table>
<p style="font-size:2pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt">&nbsp;</p>
<table style="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; font-family:Times New Roman; font-size:10.5pt" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" width="100%">
<tbody><tr style="page-break-inside:avoid">
<td width="1%">&nbsp;</td>
<td width="2%" valign="top" align="left">c.</td>
<td align="left" valign="top"> <p style=" margin-top:0pt ; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10.5pt; font-family:Times New Roman; " align="justify">“Other receivables”, which were separately presented under U.S. GAAP, have been reclassified
into “Trade and other receivables, and contract assets” under IFRS. </p></td></tr></tbody></table> <p style="font-size:2pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt">&nbsp;</p>
<table style="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; font-family:Times New Roman; font-size:10.5pt" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" width="100%">
<tbody><tr style="page-break-inside:avoid">
<td width="1%">&nbsp;</td>
<td width="2%" valign="top" align="left">d.</td>
<td align="left" valign="top"> <p style=" margin-top:0pt ; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10.5pt; font-family:Times New Roman; " align="justify">“Other financial assets”, which were included in “Prepaid expenses and other current
assets” under U.S. GAAP, are separately presented under IFRS. </p></td></tr></tbody></table> <p style="font-size:2pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt">&nbsp;</p>
<table style="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; font-family:Times New Roman; font-size:10.5pt" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" width="100%">
<tbody><tr style="page-break-inside:avoid">
<td width="1%">&nbsp;</td>
<td width="2%" valign="top" align="left">e.</td>
<td align="left" valign="top"> <p style=" margin-top:0pt ; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10.5pt; font-family:Times New Roman; " align="justify">“Film costs”, which were presented separately, and music catalogs, artist contracts, music
distribution rights and other content assets, which were included in “Intangibles, net” under U.S. GAAP are collectively reclassified and presented as “Content assets” under IFRS. “Intangibles, net” other than those
reclassified and presented as “Content assets” have been reclassified into “Other intangible assets” under IFRS. </p></td></tr></tbody></table> <p style="font-size:2pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt">&nbsp;</p>
<table style="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; font-family:Times New Roman; font-size:10.5pt" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" width="100%">
<tbody><tr style="page-break-inside:avoid">
<td width="1%">&nbsp;</td>
<td width="2%" valign="top" align="left">f.</td>
<td align="left" valign="top"> <p style=" margin-top:0pt ; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10.5pt; font-family:Times New Roman; " align="justify">“Securities investments and other”, which were separately presented under U.S. GAAP, have been
reclassified into “Investments and advances in the Financial Services segment” as <font style="white-space:nowrap">non-current</font> assets for the amounts related to the Financial Services segment and “Other financial assets”
as <font style="white-space:nowrap">non-current</font> assets for the amounts related to all segments excluding the Financial Services segment under IFRS. Housing loans in the banking business, which were included in “Securities investments and
other” under U.S. GAAP, have been reclassified into “Investments and advances in the Financial Services segment” as current assets or <font style="white-space:nowrap">non-current</font> assets under IFRS after considering the <font style="white-space:nowrap">current/non-current</font> distinction based on the terms of the contract in accordance with paragraph 66 of IAS 1. </p></td></tr></tbody></table> <p style="font-size:2pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt">&nbsp;</p>
<table style="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; font-family:Times New Roman; font-size:10.5pt" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" width="100%">
<tbody><tr style="page-break-inside:avoid">
<td width="1%">&nbsp;</td>
<td width="2%" valign="top" align="left">g.</td>
<td align="left" valign="top"> <p style=" margin-top:0pt ; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10.5pt; font-family:Times New Roman; " align="justify">“Operating lease
<font style="white-space:nowrap"><font style="white-space:nowrap">right-of-use</font></font> assets” and “Finance lease <font style="white-space:nowrap"><font style="white-space:nowrap">right-of-use</font></font> assets”, which were
separately presented under U.S. GAAP, have been reclassified into <font style="white-space:nowrap"><font style="white-space:nowrap">“Right-of-use</font></font> assets” under IFRS. </p></td></tr></tbody></table>
<p style="font-size:2pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt">&nbsp;</p>
<table style="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; font-family:Times New Roman; font-size:10.5pt" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" width="100%">
<tbody><tr style="page-break-inside:avoid">
<td width="1%">&nbsp;</td>
<td width="2%" valign="top" align="left">h.</td>
<td align="left" valign="top"> <p style=" margin-top:0pt ; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10.5pt; font-family:Times New Roman; " align="justify">“Other financial assets”, which were included in “Other” in other assets under U.S.
GAAP, are separately presented under IFRS. </p></td></tr></tbody></table> <p style="font-size:2pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt">&nbsp;</p>
<table style="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; font-family:Times New Roman; font-size:10.5pt" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" width="100%">
<tbody><tr style="page-break-inside:avoid">
<td width="1%">&nbsp;</td>
<td width="2%" valign="top" align="left">i.</td>
<td align="left" valign="top"> <p style=" margin-top:0pt ; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10.5pt; font-family:Times New Roman; " align="justify">“Current portion of long-term operating lease liabilities” and “Long-term operating lease
liabilities”, which were separately presented under U.S. GAAP, have been reclassified into “Current portion of long-term debt” and “Long-term debt”, respectively under IFRS. </p></td></tr></tbody></table>
<p style="font-size:2pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt">&nbsp;</p>
<table style="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; font-family:Times New Roman; font-size:10.5pt" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" width="100%">
<tbody><tr style="page-break-inside:avoid">
<td width="1%">&nbsp;</td>
<td width="2%" valign="top" align="left">j.</td>
<td align="left" valign="top"> <p style=" margin-top:0pt ; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10.5pt; font-family:Times New Roman; " align="justify">“Notes and accounts payable, trade”, which were separately presented under U.S. GAAP, have been
reclassified into “Trade and other payables” under IFRS. </p></td></tr></tbody></table> <p style="font-size:2pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt">&nbsp;</p>
<table style="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; font-family:Times New Roman; font-size:10.5pt" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" width="100%">
<tbody><tr style="page-break-inside:avoid">
<td width="1%">&nbsp;</td>
<td width="2%" valign="top" align="left">k.</td>
<td align="left" valign="top"> <p style=" margin-top:0pt ; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10.5pt; font-family:Times New Roman; " align="justify">“Accounts payable, other and accrued expenses”, which were separately presented under U.S. GAAP,
have been reclassified into either “Trade and other payables”, “Participation and residual liabilities in the Pictures segment”, “Other financial liabilities” or “Other current liabilities” under IFRS.
</p></td></tr></tbody></table> <p style="font-size:2pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt">&nbsp;</p>
<table style="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; font-family:Times New Roman; font-size:10.5pt" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" width="100%">
<tbody><tr style="page-break-inside:avoid">
<td width="1%">&nbsp;</td>
<td width="2%" valign="top" align="left">l.</td>
<td align="left" valign="top"> <p style=" margin-top:0pt ; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10.5pt; font-family:Times New Roman; " align="justify">“Deposits from customers in the banking business”, which were separately presented under U.S.
GAAP, have been reclassified into “Other financial liabilities” of <font style="white-space:nowrap">non-current</font> liabilities under IFRS, after considering the <font style="white-space:nowrap">current/non-current</font> distinction
based on the terms of the contract in accordance with paragraph 69 of IAS 1. </p></td></tr></tbody></table> <p style="font-size:2pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt">&nbsp;</p>
<table style="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; font-family:Times New Roman; font-size:10.5pt" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" width="100%">
<tbody><tr style="page-break-inside:avoid">
<td width="1%">&nbsp;</td>
<td width="2%" valign="top" align="left">m.</td>
<td align="left" valign="top"> <p style=" margin-top:0pt ; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10.5pt; font-family:Times New Roman; " align="justify">“Trade and other payables” and “Other financial liabilities”, which were included in
current liabilities “Other” under U.S. GAAP, are separately presented under IFRS. </p></td></tr></tbody></table> <p style="font-size:2pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt">&nbsp;</p>
<table style="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; font-family:Times New Roman; font-size:10.5pt" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" width="100%">
<tbody><tr style="page-break-inside:avoid">
<td width="1%">&nbsp;</td>
<td width="2%" valign="top" align="left">n.</td>
<td align="left" valign="top"> <p style=" margin-top:0pt ; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10.5pt; font-family:Times New Roman; " align="justify">“Participation and residual liabilities in the Pictures segment” and “Other financial
liabilities”, which were included in “Other” in other than current liabilities under U.S. GAAP, are separately presented under IFRS. </p></td></tr></tbody></table> <p style="font-size:2pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt">&nbsp;</p>
<table style="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; font-family:Times New Roman; font-size:10.5pt" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" width="100%">
<tbody><tr style="page-break-inside:avoid">
<td width="1%">&nbsp;</td>
<td width="2%" valign="top" align="left">o.</td>
<td align="left" valign="top"> <p style=" margin-top:0pt ; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10.5pt; font-family:Times New Roman; " align="justify">“Redeemable noncontrolling interest”, which was separately presented under U.S. GAAP, has been
reclassified into “Other financial liabilities” under IFRS. </p></td></tr></tbody></table> <p style="font-size:2pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt">&nbsp;</p>
<table style="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; font-family:Times New Roman; font-size:10.5pt" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" width="100%">
<tbody><tr style="page-break-inside:avoid">
<td width="1%">&nbsp;</td>
<td width="2%" valign="top" align="left">p.</td>
<td align="left" valign="top"> <p style=" margin-top:0pt ; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10.5pt; font-family:Times New Roman; " align="justify">Under U.S. GAAP, securities received as collateral other than cash in lending transactions are accounted
for as “Marketable securities” and also as “Other current liabilities” representing Sony’s obligation to return the collateral, which was 426,467&nbsp;million yen and 373,274&nbsp;million yen as of December&nbsp;31, 2020 and
March&nbsp;31, 2021, respectively. Under IFRS, the securities received as collateral other than cash shall be recognized in the consolidated statements of financial position if they are sold or the transferor defaults. None of the securities was
recognized in the consolidated statements of financial position as of December&nbsp;31, 2020 and March&nbsp;31, 2021. </p></td></tr></tbody></table> <p style="font-size:2pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt">&nbsp;</p>
<table style="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; font-family:Times New Roman; font-size:10.5pt" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" width="100%">
<tbody><tr style="page-break-inside:avoid">
<td width="1%">&nbsp;</td>
<td width="2%" valign="top" align="left">q.</td>
<td align="left" valign="top"> <p style=" margin-top:0pt ; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10.5pt; font-family:Times New Roman; " align="justify">“Other operating revenue”, which was separately presented under U.S. GAAP, has been reclassified
into “Sales” under IFRS. </p></td></tr></tbody></table> <p style="font-size:2pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt">&nbsp;</p>
<table style="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; font-family:Times New Roman; font-size:10.5pt" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" width="100%">
<tbody><tr style="page-break-inside:avoid">
<td width="1%">&nbsp;</td>
<td width="2%" valign="top" align="left">r.</td>
<td align="left" valign="top"> <p style=" margin-top:0pt ; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10.5pt; font-family:Times New Roman; " align="justify">Under IFRS, “Financial services revenue” and “Financial services expenses” have
increased by the same amount due to the gross up of revenue and expenses related to service transactions, based on the presentation requirements. </p></td></tr></tbody></table> <p style="font-size:2pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt">&nbsp;</p>
<table style="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; font-family:Times New Roman; font-size:10.5pt" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" width="100%">
<tbody><tr style="page-break-inside:avoid">
<td width="1%">&nbsp;</td>
<td width="2%" valign="top" align="left">s.</td>
<td align="left" valign="top"> <p style=" margin-top:0pt ; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10.5pt; font-family:Times New Roman; " align="justify">Under IFRS, “Financial income” and “Financial expenses” have been presented
separately, based on the presentation requirements. </p></td></tr></tbody></table>
 <p style="margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt ; font-size:8pt">&nbsp;</p> <p style="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:9pt; font-family:Times New Roman" align="center">-89- </p>

</div></center>


<p style="margin-top:1em; margin-bottom:0em; page-break-before:always">
</p><hr size="3" style="COLOR:#999999" width="100%" align="CENTER">
<h5 align="left"><a href="https://www.sec.gov/Archives/edgar/data/313838/000119312522030320/d270438d6k.htm#toc">Table of Contents</a></h5>


<center><div style="width:8.5in" align="left">
 <p style="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:5%; font-size:10.5pt; font-family:Times New Roman" align="justify"><u>Recognition and measurement differences </u></p>
<p style="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:5%; font-size:10.5pt; font-family:Times New Roman" align="justify">A. Exchange differences on translating foreign operations </p>
<p style="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:5%; font-size:10.5pt; font-family:Times New Roman" align="justify">Under IFRS 1, first-time adopters may choose to deem the cumulative exchange differences on translating foreign operations
as zero at the date of transition to IFRS. Sony has chosen to apply this exemption and transferred all cumulative exchange differences on translating foreign operations into retained earnings at the date of transition to IFRS. </p>
<p style="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:5%; font-size:10.5pt; font-family:Times New Roman" align="justify">The impact of this change is as follows: </p> <p style="font-size:12pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt">&nbsp;</p>
<table cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" width="100%" border="0" style="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; font-family:Times New Roman; font-size:9pt" align="center">


<tbody><tr>

<td valign="top"> <p style=" margin-top:0pt ; margin-bottom:0pt; margin-left:2.00em; text-indent:-1.00em; font-size:9pt; font-family:Times New Roman">&nbsp;Accumulated other comprehensive income</p></td>
<td valign="bottom">&nbsp;&nbsp;</td>
<td valign="bottom">&nbsp;</td>
<td valign="bottom" align="right">(509,872</td>
<td nowrap="" valign="bottom">)&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</td>
